Mapo tofu.directions: Fry pork until crispy. Add doubanjiang, garlic, ginger. Add broth and soy sauce. Cube tofu and gently add. Simmer 5 minutes. Thicken with cornstarch slurry. Top with ground Sichuan pepper and scallions.

Kung pao chicken (no veg).directions: Cube chicken, coat with cornstarch. Stir-fry until golden. Remove. Toast peanuts and dried chilies. Add garlic and ginger. Make sauce: soy sauce, vinegar, sugar. Return chicken, add sauce, thicken with cornstarch slurry.

General Tso's chicken.directions: Cut chicken into cubes, coat in cornstarch. Fry until crispy. Make sauce: soy sauce, vinegar, sugar, garlic, ginger. Simmer, thicken with cornstarch slurry. Fry dried chilies in sesame oil, add sauce. Toss chicken in sauce.

Orange chicken.directions: Cut chicken into cubes, coat in cornstarch. Fry in oil until golden and cooked through. Make sauce: simmer orange juice, soy sauce, vinegar, sugar, garlic until reduced. Add cornstarch slurry to thicken. Toss chicken in sauce. Garnish with orange zest.

Sesame chicken.directions: Cut chicken into pieces, coat with cornstarch. Fry until golden. Make sauce: soy sauce, honey, vinegar, sesame oil, garlic. Thicken with cornstarch slurry. Toss chicken in sauce. Top with sesame seeds.

Sweet and sour pork.directions: Cube pork, coat in egg then flour. Deep fry until golden. Make sauce: simmer pineapple juice, vinegar, ketchup, sugar, soy sauce. Thicken with cornstarch. Stir-fry pineapple chunks. Add pork to sauce, toss to coat.

Crispy honey chicken.directions: Cut chicken, coat in flour and cornstarch. Fry until very crispy. Make sauce: honey, soy sauce, garlic. Toss hot chicken in sauce. Top with sesame seeds.

Mongolian beef.directions: Slice beef thin against grain. Coat with cornstarch. Fry in hot oil until crispy. Make sauce: soy sauce, brown sugar, garlic, ginger. Pour over beef. Toss with green onions. Serve over rice.

Beef and broccoli (no broccoli).directions: Slice beef thin against grain. Marinate in soy sauce, cornstarch, and sesame oil. Stir-fry in hot wok until browned. Remove. Add garlic and ginger. Add sauce of oyster sauce, soy sauce, broth, sugar. Thicken with cornstarch. Return beef, toss. Serve over rice.

Black pepper beef.directions: Slice beef thin. Stir-fry in hot wok until browned. Add garlic and generous cracked black pepper. Add soy sauce, oyster sauce, broth. Thicken with cornstarch slurry. Serve over rice.

Cumin beef.directions: Slice beef thin. Toast cumin seeds. Stir-fry beef over high heat. Add cumin, chili flakes, garlic. Season with soy sauce. Top with fresh cilantro.

Korean fried chicken.directions: Coat wings in flour and cornstarch. Fry at 350°F for 10 minutes, remove. Increase oil to 375°F, fry again 3-4 minutes until extra crispy. Make sauce: mix gochujang, soy sauce, sugar, garlic, vinegar. Toss wings in sauce, top with sesame seeds.

Yangnyeom chicken.directions: Coat wings in rice flour and cornstarch. Double-fry until extra crispy. Make sauce with gochujang, ketchup, soy sauce, honey, garlic, ginger. Toss crispy wings in sauce.

Dakgangjeong.directions: Cut chicken into pieces. Coat heavily in cornstarch. Double fry until extra crispy. Make sticky sauce with gochugaru, soy, honey, garlic, rice syrup. Toss chicken in sauce. Top with sesame seeds.

Bulgogi.directions: Slice beef very thin. Blend pear with soy sauce, sugar, sesame oil, garlic, ginger, pepper to make marinade. Marinate beef 2-4 hours or overnight. Grill or pan-fry over high heat until caramelized but still tender. Garnish with sesame seeds.

Bulgogi rice bowl.directions: Make bulgogi marinade with pear. Marinate thin-sliced beef 2 hours. Grill until caramelized. Serve over rice with fried egg, sesame seeds, and gochujang on side.

Japchae (no veg).directions: Cook glass noodles, rinse in cold water. Slice and stir-fry beef with garlic. Toss noodles with soy sauce, sesame oil, sugar. Combine with beef. Garnish with sesame seeds and scallions.

Jjajangmyeon.directions: Dice pork belly and potato. Fry pork until crispy. Add black bean paste, cook 2 minutes. Add potato and water, simmer until potato is tender. Add sugar, thicken with cornstarch. Cook noodles. Top with sauce, garnish with julienned cucumber.

Kimchi jjigae (skip kimchi or use it).directions: Sauté pork belly until rendered. Add kimchi and stir-fry. Add gochugaru, gochujang, garlic. Pour in broth, simmer 20 minutes. Add cubed tofu, cook 5 more minutes. Garnish with scallions.

Budae jjigae.directions: Arrange sliced Spam, hot dogs, kimchi, tofu in pot. Add broth, gochugaru, gochujang. Bring to boil. Add ramen noodles. Top with American cheese slice. Cover to melt. Serve family style.

Sundubu jjigae.directions: Sauté pork with gochugaru, garlic, sesame oil. Add anchovy broth and soy sauce, bring to boil. Add silken tofu in spoonfuls. Crack egg on top before serving. Garnish with scallions.

Samgyeopsal.directions: Slice pork belly 1/3 inch thick. Grill or pan-fry until crispy on both sides. Wrap in lettuce leaf with rice, sliced garlic, gochujang and a drizzle of sesame oil.

Galbi.directions: Blend pear with soy sauce, brown sugar, sesame oil, garlic, ginger, rice wine, pepper. Marinate flanken-cut ribs 4+ hours or overnight. Grill over high heat 3-4 minutes per side until caramelized.

Kalbi jjim.directions: Blanch ribs to remove impurities. Blend pear with soy sauce, sugar, wine, garlic, ginger, sesame oil. Braise ribs in sauce at 325°F for 2.5 hours. Add potatoes last 40 minutes. Reduce sauce and glaze.

Beef short rib braise.directions: Season and brown short ribs. Add wine, reduce by half. Add broth, tomato paste, garlic, herbs. Braise covered at 300°F 3-4 hours until meat falls off bone.

Braised pork shoulder.directions: Season pork. Brown all sides. Add wine, reduce. Add broth, garlic, herbs. Braise covered at 300°F 4-5 hours until fork tender. Shred or slice. Reduce braising liquid for sauce.

Carnitas.directions: Cut pork into 2-inch chunks. Season with salt, pepper, cumin, oregano, and garlic. Place in Dutch oven with orange juice, lime juice, and lard. Cover, bake at 300°F for 3 hours. Uncover, increase to 400°F. Roast 30 minutes, shredding and crisping edges.

Al pastor.directions: Toast and rehydrate chilies. Blend with achiote, cumin, oregano, garlic, vinegar. Marinate sliced pork overnight. Grill with pineapple chunks. Chop and serve in warm tortillas with pineapple.

Carne asada.directions: Mix lime juice, oil, cumin, chili powder, garlic, salt and pepper. Marinate steak 2-4 hours. Grill over high heat 4-5 minutes per side for medium-rare. Rest 10 minutes. Slice thin against the grain.

Barbacoa.directions: Blend chipotles, broth, cumin, oregano, garlic, cloves, lime juice. Pour over beef cheeks. Slow cook covered at 300°F 4-5 hours until falling apart. Shred. Serve in warm tortillas.

Beef birria.directions: Toast and rehydrate chilies. Blend with garlic, spices, some broth. Brown beef chunks. Add chile sauce, remaining broth, bay leaves. Braise covered at 300°F 4 hours until tender. Shred. Reserve red consommé.

Birria quesadilla.directions: Dip tortilla in consommé. Place on hot griddle. Add shredded cheese and birria. Fold. Cook until crispy and cheese melts. Serve with consommé, chopped cilantro and onion.

Beef tacos.directions: Brown ground beef, drain fat. Add taco seasoning and water per package directions. Simmer 5 minutes until thickened. Warm taco shells. Fill with seasoned beef, top with shredded cheese, sour cream, and salsa.

Chicken tacos.directions: Season chicken with cumin, chili powder, garlic powder, salt. Grill or pan-fry 6-7 minutes per side. Rest 5 minutes, slice thin. Toss with lime juice. Fill taco shells with chicken, top with cheese, sour cream, salsa.

Pork tacos.directions: Season pork, slow cook in seasoning with a little water 8 hours until tender. Shred. Warm tortillas. Fill with pork, top with cilantro, lime juice, and salsa.

Taco salad (no lettuce).directions: Brown beef, add taco seasoning. Layer crushed tortilla chips with beef, cheese, beans, avocado. Top with sour cream and salsa.

Tostadas.directions: Fry tortillas until flat and crispy. Spread with refried beans. Top with chicken, crumbled queso fresco, drizzle of crema, and salsa.

Gorditas.directions: Mix masa with warm water, salt, and lard. Form thick patties. Griddle until cooked through but still soft. Slice open to create pocket. Fill with seasoned meat, cheese, sour cream, salsa.

Sopes.directions: Mix masa with water, salt, lard. Form thick rounds. Cook on griddle. Pinch edges to form rim while still warm. Add layer of beans, meat, crema, cheese, and salsa.

Huaraches.directions: Make masa dough, form into oval sandal shapes. Press indent in center, add layer of refried beans. Cook on griddle until charred. Top with sliced carne asada, queso, salsa, cream, onion, cilantro.

Tlayudas.directions: Spread large tortilla with refried beans. Top with shredded Oaxaca cheese. Toast on griddle until crispy and cheese melts. Add cooked chorizo, sliced avocado, salsa. Fold in half.

Chilaquiles (simplified).directions: Simmer salsa verde. Add tortilla chips, toss to coat and slightly soften. Top with fried eggs, crumbled queso fresco, drizzle of crema, cilantro.

Migas.directions: Beat eggs with salt and pepper. Crush tortilla chips slightly. Scramble eggs in butter, adding crushed chips while eggs are still wet. Fold in cheese. Serve with salsa.

Machaca.directions: Season beef with salt, garlic, cumin, pepper. Slow roast at 275°F 6 hours until very tender and slightly dried. Shred finely while still warm. Can be crisped in oil when ready to serve.

Chorizo and eggs.directions: Remove chorizo from casings, crumble into hot skillet. Cook until browned and fat renders. Beat eggs, pour over chorizo. Scramble together until eggs are set. Serve with warm tortillas and cheese.

Chorizo and potatoes.directions: Dice potatoes, fry in oil until golden and crispy. Remove chorizo from casing, add to pan, cook until browned. Add potatoes back, toss together. Season with garlic powder. Serve with warm tortillas.

Papas con huevo.directions: Dice potatoes small. Fry in oil until golden and crispy. Season with salt and pepper. Beat eggs, pour over potatoes. Scramble together until eggs are set. Serve with warm tortillas and salsa.

Smothered breakfast burrito.directions: Fill tortilla with scrambled eggs, crispy bacon, hash browns, and cheese. Roll into burrito. Place in baking dish, smother with green chile sauce and more cheese. Bake until bubbly. Top with sour cream.

Chimichanga.directions: Cook seasoned beef with cumin, chili powder, garlic. Place filling and cheese on large tortilla. Fold ends in, roll tight like burrito. Fry seam-side down in oil at 375°F until golden, flip, fry other side. Drain. Serve with sour cream and salsa.

Wet burrito.directions: Brown beef with taco seasoning. Fill tortilla with beans, beef, rice, cheese. Roll burrito style. Place in baking dish. Cover with enchilada sauce and more cheese. Bake at 375°F 20 minutes. Serve with sour cream.

Burrito bowl.directions: Season and grill chicken, slice. Cook rice with lime juice. Season beans with cumin. Layer in bowl: rice, beans, chicken, corn, cheese, sour cream, salsa.

Cuban sandwich.directions: Spread mustard on bread. Layer ham, roasted pork, Swiss cheese, pickles. Press in panini press or with heavy pan, buttering outside of bread. Press and cook until cheese melts and bread is crispy. Cut diagonally.

Medianoche.directions: Spread mustard on sweet bread. Layer ham, roasted pork, Swiss cheese, pickles. Butter outside of bread. Press in panini press or with heavy skillet until bread is golden and cheese melts. Cut diagonally.

Mojo pork.directions: Blend orange juice, lime juice, garlic, cumin, oregano, oil, salt for mojo. Pour over pork, marinate overnight. Slow roast covered at 300°F for 4-5 hours until fork tender. Shred and crisp edges under broiler.

Lechon.directions: Score pork skin. Rub inside with garlic, pepper, soy sauce. Stuff with lemongrass and bay leaves. Roll and tie. Salt skin heavily. Roast at 275°F 3 hours, then 450°F 30 minutes for crispy skin.

Pernil.directions: Make mojo: blend garlic, oregano, cumin, oil, lime juice, orange juice, salt, pepper. Make deep slits in pork, stuff with mojo. Marinate overnight. Roast covered at 300°F 4-5 hours. Uncover, increase to 400°F to crisp skin.

Arroz con pollo.directions: Brown chicken. Add sofrito, sazón, tomato sauce. Add rice, broth, beer, olives. Bring to boil. Reduce heat, cover, simmer 30 minutes until rice is tender and chicken cooked.

Arroz con gandules.directions: Cook bacon. Add sofrito, cook 2 minutes. Add tomato sauce, sazón, olives. Add rice, peas, broth. Bring to boil. Cover, simmer 25 minutes until rice is tender.

Moros y cristianos.directions: Cook black beans with bay leaf until tender. Fry bacon, remove. Sauté garlic, add cumin and oregano. Add rice and bean liquid. Cover, cook 20 minutes. Fold in beans and crumbled bacon.

Gallo pinto.directions: Fry leftover rice in oil. Add black beans with some liquid. Add Lizano sauce (or Worcestershire). Cook until liquid absorbed. Top with fresh cilantro. Costa Rican breakfast staple.

Pupusas.directions: Mix masa with warm water and salt. Form balls, flatten, add filling of beans, cheese, or pork. Seal and flatten into thick tortilla. Griddle on both sides until lightly charred. Serve with curtido (cabbage slaw).

Arepas.directions: Mix corn flour with warm water and salt to form dough. Shape into 1/2-inch thick patties. Griddle until golden and hollow-sounding when tapped. Split and fill with butter and cheese.

Reina pepiada.directions: Poach chicken, shred finely. Mash avocado with mayo, lime, cilantro, salt. Fold in chicken. Make arepas from dough, cook on griddle. Split and stuff with chicken-avocado mixture.

Cachapa.directions: Blend corn with eggs, sugar, salt to form thick batter. Cook like pancakes in butter until golden. Fill with sliced queso de mano. Fold in half.

Bandeja paisa.directions: Cook rice and beans separately. Fry chorizo, chicharrones, plantains. Fry eggs sunny-side up. Make arepa. Arrange all components on large platter with avocado slices.

Lomo saltado (no veg).directions: Cut beef into strips. Heat wok very hot. Sear beef quickly until browned but still pink inside. Add soy sauce, vinegar, aji paste, cumin. Toss with French fries. Serve immediately with rice.

Aji de gallina.directions: Poach chicken, shred. Soak bread in milk. Blend with aji amarillo, walnuts. Simmer sauce, add chicken. Stir in parmesan. Serve over rice with hard-boiled eggs.

Arroz con pato.directions: Brown duck legs. Blend cilantro with beer. Cook rice with cilantro-beer, broth, aji amarillo, cumin, garlic. Add duck. Bake until rice is tender and duck cooked through.

Anticuchos.directions: Cube beef heart. Marinate in aji panca, cumin, oregano, garlic, vinegar, oil overnight. Thread onto skewers. Grill over high heat 2-3 minutes per side. Brush with marinade while grilling.

Empanadas argentinas.directions: Make dough with flour and lard. Fill with seasoned ground beef, chopped eggs, olives. Fold and crimp edges. Brush with egg wash. Bake at 400°F 20-25 minutes until golden.

Choripan.directions: Grill chorizo until cooked through and slightly charred. Butterfly and open flat. Toast bread. Place chorizo in bread. Top with chimichurri and salsa criolla.

Asado.directions: Season meats with coarse salt. Grill over low indirect heat. Short ribs 2-3 hours, flank 15-20 minutes per side, sausages until cooked through. Serve with chimichurri.

Chimichurri steak.directions: Make chimichurri: finely chop parsley, oregano, garlic. Mix with vinegar, oil, red pepper flakes, salt. Let sit 20 minutes. Season steak with salt and pepper. Grill to desired doneness. Rest 5 minutes. Slice, serve with chimichurri.

Milanesa.directions: Pound steak very thin. Season with salt and pepper. Dredge in flour, beaten egg, breadcrumbs. Fry in oil over medium heat 3-4 minutes per side until golden. Serve with lemon wedges.

Milanesa napolitana.directions: Make milanesa: pound, bread, fry until golden. Place in baking dish. Top with marinara, ham, mozzarella. Bake at 400°F 10 minutes until cheese is bubbly. Serve with fries.

Chivito.directions: The Uruguayan super sandwich. Layer grilled steak, ham, bacon, cheese, fried egg, mayo on crusty bread. Garnish with olives. Massive and delicious.

Feijoada.directions: Soak beans overnight. Cook with pork shoulder, ribs, bacon, bay leaf for 2 hours. Add sliced chorizo, garlic, cook 30 minutes more. Mash some beans to thicken. Season. Serve over rice with orange slices.

Picanha.directions: Keep fat cap on. Score fat in crosshatch pattern. Season generously with salt and pepper. Grill fat-side down first over high heat. Flip and cook to medium-rare (130°F). Rest 10 minutes. Slice against grain.

Coxinha.directions: Shred cooked chicken, mix with cream cheese. Make dough with flour, butter, broth. Shape dough around filling into teardrop shape. Bread and fry until golden. Brazilian street food.

P\u00e3o de queijo.directions: Heat milk and oil until boiling. Pour over tapioca flour and salt, mix until smooth. Add eggs and grated parmesan, mix well. Form into small balls. Bake at 400°F for 20-25 minutes until puffed and golden.

Francesinha.directions: Stack bread, steak, ham, sausage in baking dish. Cover with cheese, bake until melted. Make sauce: beer, tomato, butter, piri-piri, reduced until thick. Pour sauce over. Top with fried egg.

Bacalhau.directions: Soak and desalt cod. Boil potatoes and eggs. Shred cod, mix with sliced potatoes, quartered eggs, olives. Drizzle generously with olive oil and minced garlic.

Caldo verde (no kale).directions: Simmer cubed potatoes in broth until very soft. Mash some for thickness. Slice chorizo, brown in olive oil. Add to soup with garlic. Simmer 10 minutes. Drizzle with olive oil.

Spanish tortilla.directions: Thinly slice potatoes. Gently cook in plenty of olive oil until soft but not browned. Drain, reserve oil. Beat eggs with salt, mix with potatoes. Cook in skillet, flipping onto plate when bottom sets. Slide back, cook other side.

Patatas bravas (no sauce).directions: Cut potatoes into irregular chunks. Fry in olive oil at 350°F until golden and crispy, about 10-12 minutes. Drain, season immediately with salt and smoked paprika.

Gambas al ajillo.directions: Slice garlic thin. Heat generous olive oil in cazuela. Add garlic and chili peppers, cook until garlic is golden. Add shrimp, cook 2 minutes per side. Sprinkle paprika and parsley. Serve immediately with crusty bread for dipping.

Paella (simplified).directions: Toast saffron in broth. Brown chicken and chorizo. Add garlic, paprika, rice. Add broth, don't stir. Simmer 15 minutes. Add shrimp and mussels. Cover 5 minutes until shells open and rice has socarrat on bottom.

Chorizo espa\u00f1ol.directions: Slice chorizo into coins. Pan-fry in olive oil until fat renders and edges crisp. Serve warm with crusty bread to soak up the paprika-infused oil.

Bocadillo.directions: Halve roll. Drizzle with olive oil. Rub with cut tomato. Layer jamón and sliced Manchego. Simple and perfect.

Jam\u00f3n and eggs.directions: Fry thin slices of ham in olive oil until crispy at edges. Push aside, fry eggs in same oil. Rub bread with garlic, toast. Serve eggs and ham over bread, drizzle with oil.

Fabada.directions: Soak beans overnight. Simmer with pork, bacon, bay leaf 2 hours. Add chorizo, morcilla, saffron. Cook 30 more minutes until beans are creamy. Let rest before serving.

Cocido.directions: Simmer chickpeas with meats 2-3 hours. Add potatoes and cabbage last 30 minutes. Serve in three courses: broth with noodles first, then chickpeas and vegetables, then meats.

Albondigas.directions: Mix beef with cooked rice, egg, cumin, oregano, salt. Form meatballs. Simmer broth with tomato sauce and garlic. Drop meatballs in, cook 25 minutes until cooked through.

Italian meatballs.directions: Soak breadcrumbs in milk. Mix all ingredients except marinara gently. Form 1.5-inch balls. Bake at 400°F 20 minutes. Simmer in marinara 15 minutes. Serve over pasta or as subs.

Braciole.directions: Pound steak thin. Layer prosciutto, provolone, breadcrumb mixture. Roll tightly, tie with string. Brown in oil. Simmer in marinara 2 hours until tender. Slice, serve with sauce over pasta.

Osso buco.directions: Season shanks with salt, dredge in flour. Brown in butter. Add wine, reduce by half. Add tomatoes, broth, garlic, herbs. Cover, braise at 325°F 2-2.5 hours until very tender. Serve with gremolata.

Chicken cacciatore.directions: Season chicken, brown in oil 4 minutes per side. Remove. Sauté garlic 30 seconds. Add wine, scrape fond. Add tomatoes, broth, oregano, basil. Return chicken, cover. Simmer 40 minutes until chicken is very tender.

Chicken piccata.directions: Pound chicken thin. Season, dredge in flour. Brown in butter and oil 3 minutes per side. Remove. Add broth, lemon juice, capers. Simmer 3 minutes. Swirl in cold butter for glossy sauce. Return chicken, spoon sauce over. Garnish with parsley.

Saltimbocca.directions: Place sage leaf and prosciutto on each cutlet, secure with toothpick. Dust with flour. Brown in butter 2 minutes per side. Remove. Add wine to pan, reduce by half. Swirl in more butter. Return cutlets, spoon sauce over.

Veal milanese.directions: Pound veal thin. Dredge in flour, dip in beaten egg, coat with breadcrumbs mixed with parmesan. Pan-fry in butter until golden on both sides. Serve with arugula and lemon wedges.

Cotoletta.directions: Pound cutlet thin on the bone. Season with salt. Dredge in flour, egg, fine breadcrumbs. Pan-fry in clarified butter until deep golden. Serve with lemon. The Milanese classic.

Porchetta.directions: Score pork belly. Make paste: fennel, garlic, rosemary, sage, salt, pepper, oil. Spread on inside of belly, place loin inside. Roll and tie tightly. Roast at 450°F 30 minutes, reduce to 325°F, roast 2.5 hours until skin is crackling.

Italian beef.directions: Place roast in slow cooker with broth, Italian dressing mix, and pepperoncini. Cook on low 8 hours. Shred beef. Toast bread with provolone. Fill with beef. Serve with jus for dipping.

Italian sausage sandwich.directions: Cook sausages until browned and cooked through. Toast rolls with provolone under broiler. Slice sausages or leave whole. Place in rolls. Top with warm marinara sauce.

Muffuletta.directions: Slice bread horizontally. Spread olive salad generously on both halves. Layer meats and cheeses. Close sandwich. Press with weight 30 minutes. Cut into wedges.

Po'boy.directions: Mix flour and cornmeal with Cajun seasoning. Bread shrimp and fry until golden. Split and toast French bread. Spread mayo, layer fried shrimp, pickles, dash of hot sauce.

Fried catfish.directions: Soak catfish in buttermilk 30 minutes. Mix cornmeal, flour, Cajun seasoning, salt, pepper. Dredge fish. Fry at 350°F 4-5 minutes per side until golden and cooked through.

Fried shrimp.directions: Season flour with salt, pepper, garlic powder. Beat eggs. Dredge shrimp in flour, egg, breadcrumbs. Fry at 350°F 2-3 minutes until golden. Serve with cocktail sauce.

Shrimp scampi.directions: Cook linguine. Sauté garlic in butter and oil 30 seconds. Add shrimp, cook 1 minute per side. Add wine and lemon juice, simmer 2 minutes. Season with salt and pepper. Toss with pasta and parsley.

Shrimp alfredo.directions: Cook shrimp in butter with garlic 2 minutes per side. Remove. Add cream, simmer 5 minutes. Stir in parmesan. Cook fettuccine. Toss with sauce and shrimp.

Shrimp fried rice.directions: Use cold day-old rice. Scramble eggs, set aside. Stir-fry shrimp 2 minutes, set aside. Add rice, break up, stir-fry on high. Add soy sauce, garlic, ginger. Return eggs and shrimp. Drizzle sesame oil. Top with green onions.

Coconut shrimp.directions: Butterfly shrimp. Set up breading: flour, beaten eggs, panko mixed with shredded coconut. Bread shrimp. Deep fry at 350°F 2-3 minutes until golden. Serve with sweet chili sauce.

Bang bang shrimp.directions: Mix mayo with sweet chili sauce and sriracha for sauce. Coat shrimp in flour, then egg, then cornstarch. Fry at 350°F until golden. Toss with sauce. Serve immediately.

Crab cakes.directions: Gently mix crab with mayo, egg, Dijon, Worcestershire, Old Bay, and enough breadcrumbs to bind. Form into patties, refrigerate 1 hour. Coat lightly with more breadcrumbs. Pan-fry in butter over medium heat 4 minutes per side until golden.

Crab rangoon.directions: Mix cream cheese, crab, garlic powder, Worcestershire, salt. Place 1 tsp filling on wonton wrapper. Wet edges, fold into triangle, press to seal. Deep fry at 350°F 2-3 minutes until golden. Serve with sweet chili sauce.

Fish and chips.directions: Cut potatoes into thick fries, soak 30 minutes. Fry at 325°F until soft but pale. Make batter: flour, beer, baking powder, salt. Increase oil to 375°F. Dip fish in flour, then batter. Fry 5-6 minutes until golden. Re-fry chips until crispy.

Blackened fish.directions: Coat fish with melted butter then blackening spice generously. Heat cast iron until smoking. Cook fish 3-4 minutes per side. Spices will char, creating the 'blackened' crust.

Pan-seared salmon.directions: Season salmon with salt and pepper. Heat oil in oven-safe skillet. Sear skin-side down 4 minutes. Flip, add butter and garlic. Transfer to 400°F oven 5 minutes. Finish with lemon and dill.

Teriyaki salmon.directions: Make teriyaki sauce: simmer soy, mirin, sake, sugar, garlic, ginger. Marinate salmon 30 minutes. Broil or pan-sear, basting with sauce, until caramelized. Serve over rice with sesame seeds.

Miso glazed salmon.directions: Mix miso, mirin, sake, sugar, soy sauce. Marinate salmon 30 minutes to 2 hours. Remove from marinade. Broil 4-6 minutes until caramelized and fish flakes, watching closely as it can burn quickly.

Salmon patties.directions: Mix drained salmon with breadcrumbs, egg, mayo, Dijon, lemon juice, salt, pepper. Form patties. Pan-fry in butter over medium heat 4-5 minutes per side until golden and heated through.

Tuna patties.directions: Mix drained tuna with breadcrumbs, egg, mayo, Dijon, lemon juice, salt, pepper. Form patties. Pan-fry in butter 3-4 minutes per side until golden.

Tuna noodle casserole.directions: Cook noodles. Mix with drained tuna, soup, milk, peas, salt, pepper. Transfer to baking dish. Crush potato chips over top. Bake at 350°F 30 minutes until bubbly with crispy chip top.

Tuna rice bowl.directions: Cube raw tuna. Marinate briefly in soy sauce and sesame oil. Serve over hot rice. Top with avocado slices, sesame seeds, nori strips. Serve with wasabi on side.

Spam musubi.directions: Slice Spam, pan-fry with soy sauce and sugar until glazed. Press rice into musubi mold or Spam can. Top with Spam slice and furikake. Wrap with nori strip.

Spam fried rice.directions: Dice Spam, fry until crispy. Scramble eggs, set aside. Add cold rice, stir-fry on high. Add soy sauce and garlic. Return Spam and eggs. Drizzle sesame oil. Top with green onions.

Kalua pork.directions: Score pork shoulder. Rub generously with Hawaiian salt and liquid smoke. Wrap tightly in foil. Slow roast at 275°F 8-10 hours until very tender. Shred with forks.

Chicken long rice.directions: Simmer chicken in broth with ginger until cooked. Shred chicken. Soak noodles. Add noodles to broth, cook until tender. Add soy sauce, sesame oil. Top with chicken and green onions.

Beef stew (no veg).directions: Cube beef, season with salt and pepper, dredge in flour. Brown in batches in butter in Dutch oven. Add garlic powder, tomato paste, broth, and bay leaf. Simmer covered 1.5 hours. Add cubed potatoes, simmer 30 more minutes until potatoes are tender. Remove bay leaf, adjust seasoning.

Irish stew (simplified).directions: Cut lamb into chunks. Brown in butter. Add broth, thyme, bay leaf. Simmer covered 1.5 hours. Add cubed potatoes, simmer 30 more minutes. Thicken with flour slurry. Season with salt and pepper.

Lamb chops.directions: Season chops with salt and pepper. Sear in hot oil 3-4 minutes per side for medium-rare. Add butter, garlic, rosemary, thyme. Baste with butter. Rest 5 minutes. Serve with pan juices.

Rack of lamb.directions: Season rack with salt and pepper. Sear fat-side down 4 minutes. Brush with mustard. Press on herb-breadcrumb mixture. Roast at 400°F 20-25 minutes for medium-rare (130°F). Rest 10 minutes. Slice between bones.

Lamb shanks.directions: Season shanks, brown all sides. Remove. Sauté garlic, add tomato paste. Add wine, reduce by half. Add broth, herbs. Return shanks. Braise covered at 325°F 2.5-3 hours until fork tender.

Shepherd's pie (no veg).directions: Make mashed potatoes with butter and milk. Brown lamb with garlic. Add tomato paste, broth, Worcestershire. Simmer 15 minutes until thickened. Pour into dish. Top with mashed potatoes. Bake at 400°F until golden.

Cornish pasty (simplified).directions: Dice beef and potatoes small. Season with salt and pepper. Roll pie crust into circles. Place filling on half, dot with butter. Fold over, crimp edges. Brush with beaten egg. Bake at 375°F 45-50 minutes until golden and beef is cooked.

Meat pie.directions: Brown beef with onion. Add flour, then broth and Worcestershire. Season and simmer until thickened. Pour into pie crust, top with second crust, seal edges. Bake at 375°F for 40 minutes until golden.

Steak and kidney pie.directions: Cut steak and kidney into cubes. Brown in batches. Sauté onion, add flour, then stock, Worcestershire, thyme. Add meat, simmer 1.5 hours. Pour into dish, top with puff pastry. Bake at 400°F until golden.

Pot roast.directions: Season roast with salt and pepper. Sear on all sides in butter. Add broth, garlic, thyme, bay leaf. Cover and braise at 300°F 2.5 hours. Add potatoes, braise 1 more hour. Slice roast, serve with potatoes and juice.

Yankee pot roast.directions: Season and sear roast on all sides. Add onion, garlic, tomato paste, broth, thyme, bay leaf. Braise at 325°F for 2.5 hours. Add potatoes last hour. Slice roast and serve with vegetables and gravy.

Beef on weck.directions: Warm thinly sliced roast beef in jus. Dip bottom of roll in jus. Pile beef on roll. Spread horseradish on top bun. The caraway and salt on the roll are essential.

Roast beef and gravy.directions: Season roast with salt, pepper, garlic powder, thyme. Roast at 325°F until desired doneness. Rest. Make gravy with pan drippings: add butter and flour, cook 1 minute, whisk in broth until thick. Slice beef, serve with gravy.

Prime rib.directions: Season roast generously, refrigerate overnight uncovered. Bring to room temp 2 hours before cooking. Roast at 500°F 15 minutes, reduce to 325°F. Cook until internal temp 120°F for medium-rare. Rest 20 minutes.

Ribeye steak.directions: Bring steak to room temp 30 minutes. Season generously with salt and pepper. Sear in very hot cast iron 4-5 minutes per side for medium-rare. Add butter, garlic, herbs. Baste. Rest 5-10 minutes.

New York strip.directions: Bring steak to room temp. Season heavily with salt and pepper. Sear in very hot pan 4-5 minutes per side for medium-rare. Add butter, garlic, thyme. Baste. Rest 5 minutes.

Filet mignon.directions: Season filet with salt and pepper. Sear in hot oil and butter 4 minutes per side for medium-rare. Add garlic last minute, baste with butter. Rest 5 minutes. Internal temp 130°F for medium-rare.

Steak au poivre.directions: Crush peppercorns coarsely, press onto steaks. Season with salt. Sear in butter 4 minutes per side. Remove. Sauté shallots. Add brandy (flame carefully). Add cream, reduce until thickened. Pour over steaks.

Steak diane.directions: Pound steaks thin. Season, sear in butter 1-2 minutes per side. Remove. Add shallots, Worcestershire, brandy, mustard. Flame. Add cream, reduce. Return steaks to coat. Garnish with parsley.

Steak frites.directions: Cut potatoes into fries. Fry at 325°F until soft, then 375°F until crispy. Season steak. Sear 4-5 minutes per side. Add butter, garlic, thyme, baste. Rest. Serve with fries, topped with parsley and flaky salt.

Country fried steak.directions: Pound steaks thin. Season flour with salt, pepper, garlic powder. Beat egg with milk. Dredge steaks in flour, egg wash, flour again. Fry in 1/2 inch oil at 350°F 4-5 minutes per side. Drain. Make white gravy with drippings.

Cube steak and gravy.directions: Season flour with salt, pepper, garlic powder. Dredge steaks. Brown in oil. Remove. Add butter and flour to pan, then broth. Return steaks, simmer covered 30 minutes until tender.

Swiss steak.directions: Season steaks, dredge in flour. Brown in butter. Add tomatoes, broth, Worcestershire, garlic. Cover. Braise in oven at 325°F 2 hours until very tender.

Smash burger with caramelized cheese cru.directions: Smash thin patty on hot griddle. Season. When almost done, add cheese on and around patty. Let cheese touching griddle get crispy and lacy. Fold onto patty. Toast buns. Assemble.

Butter-basted ribeye with bone marrow bu.directions: Roast marrow bones, scrape out marrow, mash with soft butter. Sear steak 4 minutes per side. Add marrow butter, garlic, herbs. Baste. Rest with a dollop of marrow butter on top.

Nashville hot chicken.directions: Marinate chicken in buttermilk overnight. Season flour with salt, pepper, some cayenne. Dredge and fry at 350°F until done. Make hot oil: melt lard, add cayenne, brown sugar, paprika, garlic powder. Brush hot chicken generously with spicy oil. Serve on white bread with pickles.

Birria grilled cheese.directions: Dip bread in consommé. Butter outside. Layer shredded birria and cheese between bread. Grill until bread is crispy and cheese melts. Serve with consommé for dipping.

Korean corn dog.directions: Skewer hot dogs or mozzarella (or half and half). Coat in flour, then egg, then panko mixed with a bit of sugar. Deep fry at 350°F until golden, 3-4 minutes. Brush with sugar. Serve with ketchup and mustard.

Elote-style loaded fries.directions: Fry crispy fries. Mix mayo with crema. Drizzle over fries. Top with crumbled cotija, chili powder, squeeze of lime, fresh cilantro. Street corn flavors on fries.

Truffle shuffle mac and cheese.directions: Make roux with butter and flour, add milk. Melt in cheddar and gruyere. Toss with cooked macaroni, drizzle with truffle oil. Top with breadcrumbs and parmesan. Bake at 375°F for 25 minutes until bubbly.

Lobster mac and cheese.directions: Cook lobster, chop meat. Make cheese sauce: roux with butter and flour, add milk, stir in cheeses, season with salt and cayenne. Cook macaroni, fold in sauce and lobster. Top with buttered breadcrumbs. Bake at 375°F 20 minutes.

Loaded potato soup in a bread bowl.directions: Fry bacon until crispy. Make roux with butter and flour. Add broth, milk, and diced potatoes. Simmer until tender. Mash some potatoes for thickness. Add cheese. Serve in hollowed bread bowl topped with bacon, sour cream, chives.

Double-fried Korean fried chicken.directions: Coat wings in flour and cornstarch. Fry at 350°F 10 minutes. Rest 5 minutes. Fry again at 375°F 3-4 minutes until super crispy. Toss in gochujang-honey-soy glaze. Top with sesame seeds.

Beef Wellington.directions: Sear seasoned tenderloin all sides. Brush with mustard. Finely chop mushrooms, cook until dry. Layer plastic wrap, prosciutto, mushrooms. Place beef, roll tight. Wrap in puff pastry. Brush with egg. Bake at 425°F 25-30 minutes.

Reverse-sear tomahawk steak.directions: Season steak generously, rest at room temperature. Bake at 250°F until internal temp reaches 115°F. Rest 10 minutes. Sear in screaming hot cast iron with butter, herbs, and garlic. Baste continuously. Rest and slice.

Smoked then fried chicken wings.directions: Season wings with rub and smoke at 225°F for 1.5 hours. Chill. Deep fry at 375°F until skin is crispy. Toss in butter-hot sauce mixture. Serve immediately.

Pork schnitzel the size of the plate.directions: Pound pork extremely thin (1/8 inch). Season with salt. Dredge in flour, beaten egg, breadcrumbs. Fry in half butter, half oil until deep golden, 3-4 minutes per side. Larger than plate. Serve with lemon wedges.

Juicy Lucy.directions: Form beef into thin patties. Place cube of cheese on one patty, cover with another, seal edges completely. Season with salt and pepper. Grill 5-6 minutes per side. Let rest 3 minutes (cheese is molten!). Toast buns, assemble.

Patty melt on marbled rye with thousand.directions: Cook thin patty. Caramelize onions. Butter rye bread. Layer: rye, Swiss, patty, onions, thousand island, Swiss, rye. Grill in pan until bread is crispy and cheese melts.

Cast iron deep dish pizza.directions: Oil cast iron. Press dough up sides. Layer sliced mozzarella on bottom. Add cooked sausage. Top with seasoned crushed tomatoes. Sprinkle parmesan. Bake at 425°F 25-30 minutes.

Detroit-style pizza.directions: Oil Detroit-style pan. Press dough to edges, let rise 1 hour. Cube cheese, spread to edges (key for crispy cheese edges). Add pepperoni. Top with stripes of seasoned tomato sauce. Bake at 500°F 12-15 minutes until cheese edges caramelize.

Vodka rigatoni with burrata.directions: Sauté garlic and pepper flakes. Add tomato paste, cook until darkened. Add vodka, reduce. Stir in cream and parmesan. Toss with cooked rigatoni. Plate and top with burrata and fresh basil.

Cacio e pepe with a parmesan crisp bowl.directions: Make parmesan crisps in oven, drape over bowl to form edible bowl. Make classic cacio e pepe: pasta, pecorino, pasta water, lots of pepper. Serve in parmesan bowl.

Carbonara with guanciale and runny yolk.directions: Cook spaghetti in salted water. Whisk whole eggs, yolks, and grated cheeses. Cut guanciale into strips, render in pan until crispy. Reserve 1 cup pasta water. Drain pasta, add to guanciale off heat. Quickly toss in egg mixture, adding pasta water to create creamy sauce. Top with extra yolk and pepper.

Short rib ragu pappardelle.directions: Brown short ribs. Add wine, reduce. Add tomatoes, broth, garlic, herbs. Braise covered at 300°F 3-4 hours. Shred meat into sauce. Cook pappardelle. Toss with ragu and parmesan.

Oxtail ragu.directions: Brown oxtails. Add wine, reduce. Add tomatoes, broth, tomato paste, garlic, herbs. Braise covered at 300°F 4 hours until meat falls off bone. Shred meat into sauce. Serve over pappardelle.

Lamb shank osso buco style.directions: Season and brown lamb shanks. Sauté vegetables, add tomato paste and wine. Add broth, garlic, rosemary. Braise at 325°F for 2.5 hours until tender. Make gremolata with parsley, lemon zest, garlic. Serve shanks with sauce and gremolata.

Duck fat fries with truffle aioli.directions: Make truffle aioli: mayo with truffle oil, minced garlic, lemon juice. Fry potatoes in duck fat until perfectly crispy. Season with salt and parsley. Serve with truffle aioli.

Poutine with braised short rib.directions: Braise short ribs with wine, broth, onion, thyme at 325°F for 3 hours. Shred meat. Fry fresh-cut potatoes twice for crispy fries. Top with curds, shredded beef, and hot beef gravy.

Disco fries deluxe.directions: Fry crispy fries. Top with hot gravy and shredded mozzarella. Broil until cheese melts. Add bacon bits, sliced jalapeños, dollop of sour cream.

Loaded baked potato bar with all the mea.directions: Bake potatoes at 400°F 1 hour until tender. Split open, fluff with fork. Add butter, salt, pepper. Set up toppings: sour cream, shredded cheese, bacon crumbles, pulled pork, chopped brisket. Let people build their own.

Hasselback potatoes with bacon and gruye.directions: Make Hasselback cuts in potatoes. Bake at 425°F 30 minutes. Insert thin slices of bacon and Gruyère between cuts. Continue baking 20-25 minutes until crispy. Serve with sour cream.

Pommes souffl\u00e9es.directions: Slice potatoes 1/8 inch thick. Par-fry at 325°F until slightly cooked. Remove, let cool. Fry again at 375°F - potatoes will puff up like pillows. Drain and salt immediately. Serve at once.

Potatoes Anna.directions: Slice potatoes paper thin. Brush pan with clarified butter. Layer potatoes in overlapping spiral, brushing each layer with butter, seasoning with salt and pepper. Bake at 425°F for 45 minutes. Invert onto plate.

Fondant potatoes.directions: Cut potatoes into cylinders. Season and sear in butter until golden on both flat sides. Add broth, garlic, thyme. Braise in 425°F oven until tender and bottoms are crusty.

Smoked brisket with burnt ends.directions: Coat brisket with rub. Smoke at 225-250°F until internal temp 165°F. Wrap with some broth. Continue until 200-205°F. Cube the point, toss with BBQ sauce, brown sugar, butter. Return to smoker 2 hours for burnt ends.

Competition-style ribs.directions: Apply rub. Smoke at 225°F 3 hours. Wrap in foil with butter, sugar, honey. Smoke 2 more hours. Unwrap, glaze with sauce, smoke 30 more minutes for set glaze.

Cochon de lait.directions: Season pig inside and out with Cajun spices. Roast slowly in caja china or on spit over coals 6-8 hours until skin is crispy and meat falls off bone. Louisiana style.

Peking duck pancakes.directions: Warm pancakes. Slice crispy duck skin and meat. Spread hoisin on pancake. Add duck, cucumber strips, green onion strips. Roll up and eat.

Char siu burnt ends.directions: Cube pork. Marinate in char siu sauce. Smoke at 250°F 2 hours. Toss with more sauce and honey. Continue smoking, stirring occasionally, until sticky and caramelized. Top with sesame seeds.

XO fried rice.directions: Cook rice day ahead, refrigerate. Stir-fry shrimp, set aside. Scramble eggs, set aside. Fry garlic, add cold rice and XO sauce. High heat until rice is toasted. Add soy sauce, eggs, shrimp. Garnish with scallions.

Loco moco with wagyu patty.directions: Form wagyu patties, season and cook to medium. Make gravy with caramelized onions, broth, soy sauce. Serve over hot rice, top with patty, fried egg, and plenty of gravy.

Croque madame.directions: Make béchamel: melt butter, whisk in flour, add milk, season with salt and nutmeg. Layer ham and cheese between bread slices. Spread béchamel on top, add more cheese. Broil until bubbly. Fry egg, place on top. Serve immediately.

Croque monsieur grilled cheese.directions: Make béchamel: melt 2 tbsp butter, whisk in flour, add milk, season. Spread Dijon on bread. Layer ham and cheese. Spread béchamel on top, more cheese. Bake at 400°F 10 minutes, then broil until golden.

Monte Cristo.directions: Layer ham, turkey, Swiss between bread slices. Beat eggs with milk. Dip sandwich in egg mixture. Grill in butter until golden on both sides and cheese melts. Dust with powdered sugar. Serve with raspberry jam.

Cuban sandwich pressed until flat and cr.directions: Layer ingredients in bread. Butter generously. Press with extreme pressure until sandwich is flat, cheese completely melted, and bread golden and shattering crisp.

Cheesesteak with whiz wit no wit.directions: Freeze steak 30 minutes. Slice paper thin. Season. Cook on blazing hot griddle, chopping as it cooks. Pile meat, drizzle generously with Cheez Whiz. Scoop into toasted roll. Authentic Philly style without onions.

Prime rib French dip with horseradish cr.directions: Slice prime rib thin. Toast split French bread in butter. Layer with provolone and prime rib. Mix horseradish with sour cream. Serve sandwich with warm au jus for dipping and horseradish cream.

Thanksgiving sandwich.directions: Toast bread with butter. Layer sliced turkey, stuffing, cranberry sauce. Drizzle with warm gravy. Top with another slice of bread. Press slightly.

Muffuletta with olive tapenade.directions: Make olive tapenade with mixed olives, giardiniera, garlic, olive oil. Slice bread horizontally. Spread tapenade on both sides. Layer meats and cheese. Press sandwich, let marinate 30 minutes before slicing.

Fried chicken sandwich with spicy honey.directions: Marinate chicken in buttermilk. Season flour with salt and cayenne. Dredge and fry at 350°F 8 minutes until done. Mix honey with hot sauce. Toast buttered buns. Assemble: bun, chicken, pickles, drizzle spicy honey.

Breakfast burger.directions: Form beef patties. Season and grill to desired doneness. Top with cheese. Cook bacon until crispy. Fry eggs with runny yolks. Stack: bun, patty, bacon, fried egg.

Donut burger.directions: Form beef patties. Season and grill. Top with cheese. Slice glazed donuts horizontally. Use as buns. Add bacon. Sweet meets savory.

Peanut butter bacon burger.directions: Form beef patties, season generously. Grill to desired doneness. Top with cheddar, let melt. Spread peanut butter on toasted bun. Stack patty with crispy bacon and pickled jalapeños.

Green chile cheeseburger.directions: Form beef into patties. Season with salt and pepper. Grill or pan-fry to desired doneness. Top with cheese and generous amount of roasted green chiles. Cover to melt cheese. Toast buns, assemble burger.

Pastrami burger.directions: Form beef patties, season with salt and pepper. Grill or pan-fry. Top with Swiss cheese. Toast buttered rye bread. Stack: rye, dressing, patty, warm pastrami, more dressing, rye.

Patty melt with Wagyu.directions: Slowly caramelize onions in butter, 30 minutes. Form wagyu patties, season and cook. Butter rye bread, grill. Layer Swiss, patty, onions, more Swiss. Press and grill until cheese melts. Serve with Thousand Island.

Quesabirria with consomm\u00e9.directions: Dip tortilla in red birria consommé. Place on hot griddle, add shredded birria and cheese. Fold, cook until crispy and cheese melts. Serve with warm consommé for dipping, topped with cilantro and onion.

Stacked enchiladas New Mexico style.directions: Brown beef with onion. Dip tortillas in red chile sauce. Stack tortilla, beef, cheese, repeat 3 times. Bake until cheese melts. Top each stack with fried egg, lettuce, sour cream.

Wet burrito smothered in both sauces.directions: Fill tortilla with seasoned beef, beans, rice, cheese. Roll burrito. Place in baking dish. Cover half with red sauce, half with green. Top with more cheese. Bake until bubbly. Top with sour cream and onion.

Chimichanga deep fried and smothered.directions: Fill tortilla with seasoned beef and cheese. Roll tightly, secure with toothpicks. Deep fry at 375°F until golden and crispy all over. Remove picks. Smother with hot queso. Top with sour cream and guacamole.

Carnitas with the crispy bits.directions: Cube pork, season well. Simmer covered in juices with lard until tender. Remove lid, increase heat. Let liquid evaporate and pork crisp in rendered fat. Make sure to get those crispy caramelized bits.

Birria consomm\u00e9 ramen.directions: Heat consommé with some shredded birria. Cook ramen noodles. Serve noodles in red consommé with meat. Side of cheese quesadilla dipped in consommé. Top with cilantro and lime.

Tonkotsu ramen with all the fixings.directions: Boil pork bones 12+ hours for milky broth. Braise pork belly in soy-mirin, slice. Marinate soft-boiled eggs in soy. Assemble: noodles, creamy broth, pork slices, marinated egg, nori, scallions, garlic oil.

Miso ramen with torched pork belly.directions: Make broth with chicken stock and white miso. Braise pork belly, slice thick. Torch slices until caramelized. Assemble: noodles, miso broth, torched pork, corn, butter, egg, scallions.

Spicy miso with ground pork bomb.directions: Season pork with garlic, ginger, chili paste. Form into ball. Make spicy miso broth. Cook noodles. Place pork bomb in center of bowl, add noodles and broth. Top with egg and scallions. Break apart pork to eat.

Dan dan noodles with chili crisp oil.directions: Cook noodles. Make sauce: sesame paste, soy, vinegar, generous chili crisp oil. Stir-fry pork with garlic until crispy. Serve noodles with sauce, topped with pork, ground Sichuan peppercorn, green onions.

Mapo tofu if you have tofu.directions: Fry pork until crispy. Add doubanjiang, garlic, ginger. Add broth and soy sauce. Cube tofu and gently add. Simmer 5 minutes. Thicken with cornstarch. Top with ground Sichuan pepper and scallions.

Xiao long bao.directions: Make dough, rest. Cube aspic, mix with seasoned pork, ginger, scallions. Roll thin wrappers, fill and pleat closed (18+ folds). Steam 8 minutes. Serve with black vinegar and ginger.

Peking duck fat fried rice.directions: Heat wok with generous duck fat. Scramble eggs, remove. Add more duck fat, fry cold rice until crispy. Add soy sauce, chopped duck meat. Return eggs. Toss with green onions and drizzle of hoisin.

Szechuan dry fried chicken.directions: Cube chicken, marinate in soy and wine. Coat in cornstarch, deep fry until crispy. Stir-fry chilies and peppercorns until fragrant. Add garlic, ginger, fried chicken. Toss until dry and coated. Garnish with scallions.

Salt and pepper pork chop.directions: Cut pork into strips, coat in cornstarch. Deep fry until golden and crispy. Stir-fry garlic and jalapeños. Add fried pork, toss with salt, white pepper, five spice. Garnish with scallions.

Honey walnut shrimp.directions: Candy walnuts in sugar water, bake until crispy. Coat shrimp in egg and cornstarch. Fry until golden. Mix mayo, honey, and condensed milk. Toss fried shrimp in sauce, top with candied walnuts.

Peking pork chops.directions: Pound pork thin, dredge in flour, dip in egg, coat in cornstarch. Fry until golden. Make sauce with ketchup, Worcestershire, sugar, soy, vinegar. Simmer until glossy. Pour over crispy pork chops.

XO crispy noodles.directions: Par-boil noodles, drain well. Pan-fry in oil until one side is crispy. Flip, crisp other side. Stir-fry beef and shrimp with garlic. Add XO sauce, soy, oyster sauce. Pour over crispy noodle cake. Garnish with scallions.

Salt and pepper crab.directions: Clean and quarter crab. Coat pieces in cornstarch. Deep fry until shell is crispy. Stir-fry garlic, ginger, jalapeños. Add fried crab, toss with salt and white pepper. Garnish with scallions.

General Tso's but actually crispy.directions: Cut chicken into pieces. Double coat in cornstarch for extra crunch. Fry at 350°F until super crispy, 6-7 minutes. Make sauce: soy, vinegar, sugar, garlic, ginger. Fry chilies in sesame oil, add sauce, thicken. Toss chicken in sauce just before serving.

Orange beef.directions: Slice beef thin, coat with cornstarch. Fry until crispy. Make sauce: simmer orange juice, zest, soy sauce, sugar, garlic, ginger until reduced. Thicken with cornstarch slurry. Toss beef in sauce.

Mongolian beef with crispy edges.directions: Slice beef thin, coat heavily with cornstarch. Deep fry until very crispy edges. Make thick sauce: soy sauce, brown sugar, garlic, ginger, thicken with cornstarch. Toss beef in sauce quickly. Top with sesame seeds and green onions.

Bulgogi with the char.directions: Blend marinade with pear. Marinate very thin beef 4+ hours. Cook on blazing hot grill or cast iron for maximum char, 1-2 minutes per side. Top with green onions.

Korean fried chicken and waffles.directions: Coat chicken in rice flour and cornstarch. Double-fry for extra crispy. Make glaze with gochujang and honey. Toss chicken in glaze. Serve on crispy waffles with butter and maple syrup.

Kimchi fried rice with crispy rice botto.directions: Fry diced pork belly until crispy. Add chopped kimchi, cook 3 minutes. Add rice, press into pan. Don't stir - let bottom get very crispy. Add gochujang, soy sauce. Top with fried egg and sesame oil.

Budae jjigae loaded.directions: Arrange all meats, kimchi, tofu, rice cakes in large pot. Add broth and gochujang. Simmer 10 minutes. Add ramen. Top with cheese. Cover to melt. Ultimate army stew.

Galbi with ssamjang.directions: Make galbi marinade with pear. Marinate flanken-cut ribs overnight. Grill until caramelized. Serve with lettuce wraps, ssamjang sauce, and rice.

Bo ssam feast.directions: Rub pork with salt and sugar. Roast at 300°F 6 hours, then blast at 500°F until caramelized. Make gochujang sauce with vinegar. Shred pork. Serve with lettuce, rice, sauce, and kimchi for wrapping.

Samgyeopsal with all the sides.directions: Slice pork belly thick. Grill until rendered and crispy on edges. Dip in sesame oil and salt. Wrap in lettuce or perilla with ssamjang, grilled garlic, and kimchi. Serve with rice.

KBBQ-style ribeye.directions: Slice ribeye thin. Marinate in soy sauce, sesame oil, garlic, sugar, pepper for 30 minutes. Grill on high heat quickly, 1-2 minutes per side. Serve over rice with sesame seeds.

Jjajangmyeon with extra sauce.directions: Dice pork, potato, onion, zucchini. Fry pork until rendered. Add vegetables, cook until soft. Add black bean paste and water. Simmer and thicken with cornstarch. Serve over boiled noodles with cucumber.

Filipino adobo with crispy skin.directions: Marinate chicken in soy sauce, vinegar, garlic, bay leaf, peppercorns 1-4 hours. Transfer all to pot, add 1/2 cup water. Simmer covered 30 minutes. Remove chicken, reduce sauce. Pan-fry chicken skin-side down until very crispy. Serve with sauce.

Lechon kawali.directions: Simmer pork belly with bay leaves, salt, pepper until tender, about 1.5 hours. Drain, refrigerate until cold and dry. Deep fry at 375°F until skin is crispy. Serve with soy-vinegar dipping sauce with garlic.

Sisig.directions: Boil pork until tender. Grill or broil until crispy. Chop finely. Sizzle on hot plate with butter, soy sauce, calamansi, jalapeños. Stir in mayo. Top with raw egg to cook on hot sizzling plate.

Kare-kare.directions: Braise oxtail until tender, 3 hours. Make sauce with peanut butter, annatto oil, broth. Add vegetables, simmer until cooked. Serve with rice and shrimp paste on the side.

Crispy pata.directions: Simmer pork leg with bay and peppercorns 2-3 hours until tender. Refrigerate until cold and dry. Deep fry at 350°F until skin is super crispy. Serve with soy-vinegar-garlic dip.

Lomi.directions: Sauté garlic and onion. Add pork, cook through. Add liver and fish balls. Pour in broth, bring to boil. Add noodles, cook until soft. Thicken with cornstarch. Crack eggs and stir gently for ribbons.

Sinigang with pork ribs.directions: Boil pork ribs until tender, about 1 hour. Add tamarind paste and fish sauce. Add radish, cook 10 minutes. Add water spinach last minute. Season with salt. Serve with rice.

Spam silog.directions: Slice Spam, pan-fry until crispy on both sides. Fry eggs sunny-side up. Make garlic rice by frying garlic in oil, adding day-old rice. Serve Spam and egg over garlic rice with vinegar-soy dipping sauce.

Longganisa and eggs.directions: Add longganisa to pan with splash of water. Cook until water evaporates and sausages brown in their own fat. Fry eggs. Make garlic rice. Serve together with vinegar for dipping.

Tocino.directions: Slice pork thin. Cure with sugar, salt, garlic, pineapple juice, annatto for 3+ days. Pan-fry with splash of water until caramelized. Serve with garlic rice and fried egg.

Tapsilog.directions: Slice beef thin. Marinate in soy sauce, calamansi, garlic, pepper overnight. Pan-fry beef quickly over high heat. Fry eggs. Make garlic rice. Serve together - tapa, sinangag, itlog.

Hawaiian loco moco piled high.directions: Cook rice. Make thick gravy with broth and mix. Form beef into patties, season, pan-fry. Fry eggs with runny yolks. Stack: rice, patty, more patty, gravy, fried egg on top. Drizzle more gravy.

Kalua pig with crispy bits.directions: Rub pork with salt and liquid smoke. Wrap in banana leaves (or foil). Slow roast at 275°F 8-10 hours until fall-apart tender. Shred. Crisp some shreds under broiler or in hot pan.

Laulau without the lau.directions: Cut pork and beef into chunks. Season with Hawaiian salt. Place meat and butterfish on ti leaves (or foil if unavailable). Wrap tightly. Steam for 4 hours until pork is fall-apart tender.

Chicken katsu curry.directions: Make curry: cook cubed potatoes in water until tender, add curry roux blocks. Make chicken katsu: bread and fry cutlet. Serve rice with curry sauce, topped with sliced katsu.

Katsu sando.directions: Make tonkatsu: pound, bread with flour, egg, panko. Fry until golden. Spread tonkatsu sauce on soft milk bread. Add shredded cabbage, sliced cutlet, more sauce. Press slightly. Cut off crusts, slice diagonally.

Wagyu sando.directions: Pound wagyu thin. Bread in flour, egg, panko. Deep fry until golden but still medium-rare inside. Trim crusts from shokupan. Spread with mustard, add cabbage, cutlet, tonkatsu sauce. Cut into rectangles.

Japanese hamburg steak.directions: Soak breadcrumbs in milk. Mix with meats, egg, salt. Form oval patties with indent in center. Pan-fry 4 minutes per side. Make sauce: melt butter, add ketchup, Worcestershire, soy sauce. Serve over patties with rice.

Omurice.directions: Cook diced chicken in butter. Add cooked rice and ketchup, stir-fry until well mixed. Shape into mound on plate. Beat eggs, cook thin omelette. Slide omelette over rice mound. Drizzle with more ketchup.

Yoshinoya-style gyudon.directions: Slice beef paper thin. Simmer onion in dashi, soy, mirin, sake, sugar until soft. Add beef, cook just until no longer pink. Serve over hot rice. Top with raw egg and pickled ginger.

Beef donburi with torched beef.directions: Make sauce: simmer soy, mirin, sake, sugar. Slice beef thin. Sear quickly then torch for char. Arrange over rice. Drizzle sauce. Top with raw egg yolk, green onions, nori strips.

Mentaiko pasta.directions: Cook pasta al dente. Mix softened butter with mentaiko roe (removed from sac). Toss hot pasta with mentaiko butter, splash of cream and soy sauce. Top with shredded nori and shiso.

Tori paitan ramen.directions: Boil chicken bones vigorously for 6+ hours until broth is milky white. Season with soy and mirin. Grill chicken thighs. Serve noodles in creamy broth with chicken, egg, nori, scallions.

Tsukemen.directions: Make concentrated dipping broth with dashi, soy, mirin. Chill noodles after cooking. Braise and slice pork belly. Serve cold noodles separately from hot dipping broth. Dip noodles, slurp, repeat.

Mazemen.directions: Cook thick noodles. Brown ground pork with garlic. Toss noodles with soy sauce, sesame oil, and chili oil. Top with pork, raw egg yolk, scallions, nori. Mix everything together before eating.

Tantanmen.directions: Make broth with chicken stock, sesame paste, chili oil, soy sauce. Brown ground pork with Sichuan peppercorns. Cook noodles and bok choy. Serve noodles in sesame broth topped with spicy pork and scallions.

Champon.directions: Stir-fry pork, seafood, and cabbage. Add broth, milk, soy sauce, sake, garlic. Simmer 10 minutes. Add noodles. Cook until noodles tender. The Nagasaki specialty.

Yakisoba with extra sauce and nori.directions: Slice pork belly, stir-fry until crispy. Add shredded cabbage. Add noodles and generous yakisoba sauce. Toss until well coated. Serve topped with nori strips and pickled ginger.

Takoyaki without octopus.directions: Make batter with flour, dashi, eggs. Heat takoyaki pan, fill molds. Add bacon and cheese cubes to each. Turn with picks until spherical and golden. Top with sauce, mayo, bonito flakes.

Okonomiyaki.directions: Mix flour, eggs, dashi, and shredded cabbage. Pour batter into oiled pan, top with pork belly slices. Cook 5 minutes until bottom is golden. Flip, cook 5 more minutes. Top with okonomiyaki sauce, mayo, bonito flakes.

Hiroshima-style okonomiyaki.directions: Make thin crepe. Pile shredded cabbage on top. Add pork slices. Cook yakisoba separately with sauce. Fry eggs flat. Stack: crepe, cabbage, pork, noodles, fried egg. Flip. Top with sauce and mayo.

Monjayaki.directions: Make thin batter with flour and dashi. Mix with cabbage, shrimp, toppings. Pour on griddle, form ring. Pour batter in center. When bottom is crispy, scrape and eat directly from griddle with small spatula.

Tonpeiyaki.directions: Cook thin slices of pork belly until crispy. Beat eggs, pour over pork to form thin omelette. Add shredded cabbage. Roll into cylinder when eggs are set. Drizzle with sauce and mayo, top with scallions.

Negima... just chicken thighs.directions: Cut thighs into bite-sized pieces. Thread onto skewers. Make tare by simmering soy, mirin, sake, sugar until reduced. Grill skewers, basting repeatedly with tare. Serve with extra tare drizzled over.

Tsukune with raw egg dip.directions: Mix chicken with panko, ginger, salt. Form ovals on skewers. Grill, basting with tare made from soy, mirin, sake, sugar. Serve with raw egg yolk for dipping, garnish with scallions.

Chicken nanban.directions: Make tartar sauce: mayo, chopped hard-boiled egg, pickles. Cut chicken, dredge in flour and egg. Fry until golden. Make nanban sauce: vinegar, soy sauce, sugar. Dip fried chicken in sauce. Top with tartar.

Karaage.directions: Cut chicken into bite-sized pieces. Marinate in soy sauce, sake, grated ginger, garlic 30 minutes. Coat generously with potato starch. Fry at 340°F 3 minutes, rest 2 minutes, fry again at 375°F 2 minutes until very crispy. Serve with lemon.

Miso black cod.directions: Make marinade: mix miso, mirin, sake, sugar. Marinate cod for 2-3 days. Wipe off excess marinade. Broil until caramelized and fish flakes easily. Serve with pickled ginger.

Sake-glazed salmon.directions: Make glaze by reducing sake, mirin, soy sauce, sugar with ginger. Sear salmon skin-side down. Flip, baste with glaze. Finish in oven at 400°F. Glaze again, top with sesame seeds.

Unagi don.directions: Make tare by reducing soy, mirin, sake, sugar until glossy. Brush eel with tare, broil until glazed. Repeat 3-4 times for thick glaze. Serve over hot rice, drizzle with extra tare, sprinkle sansho pepper.

Chirashi bowl.directions: Season rice with rice vinegar. Arrange assorted sashimi slices over rice. Add tamagoyaki, roe, nori strips. Serve with soy sauce, wasabi, and pickled ginger.

Spicy tuna crispy rice.directions: Press sushi rice into rectangles, chill. Pan-fry rice cakes until crispy on both sides. Dice tuna, mix with sriracha, mayo, sesame oil. Top each crispy rice with spicy tuna. Garnish with scallions and sesame.

Beef tataki.directions: Sear beef on all sides until just charred outside but rare inside. Ice bath to stop cooking. Slice thin. Make ponzu-style sauce with soy, vinegar, ginger, garlic. Drizzle over beef. Top with green onions.

Poke bowl.directions: Cube raw tuna. Marinate in soy sauce, sesame oil, rice vinegar for 15 minutes. Serve over warm rice. Top with avocado, seaweed salad, sesame seeds.

Spam musubi deluxe.directions: Slice Spam thin, pan-fry until crispy. Glaze with teriyaki. Make thin egg sheet. Season rice with furikake. Layer in musubi mold: rice, egg, glazed Spam, more rice. Wrap with nori strip.

Shoyu poke.directions: Cube fresh ahi tuna. Toss with soy sauce, sesame oil, thinly sliced sweet onion, scallions, sesame seeds. Let marinate 15 minutes. Serve over rice with seaweed salad on the side.

Steak tartare.directions: Hand-chop beef very fine. Mix with capers, shallots, parsley, mustard, Worcestershire, salt, pepper. Form into patty, make indent, place raw yolk in center. Serve with toast points.

Beef carpaccio.directions: Freeze beef 1-2 hours for easier slicing. Slice paper thin. Pound even thinner between plastic. Arrange on cold plates. Season with salt and pepper. Top with arugula, shaved parmesan, capers. Drizzle oil and lemon juice.

Steak frites with caf\u00e9 de Paris but.directions: Make compound butter: blend butter with curry, capers, anchovy, parsley, shallots, mustard. Cut potatoes into fries, double-fry until crispy. Sear steak. Top with slice of compound butter while resting. Serve with frites.

Duck confit.directions: Rub duck legs with salt, pepper, thyme, garlic. Cure in fridge 24-48 hours. Rinse, pat dry. Submerge in duck fat with bay leaf. Bake at 225°F 3-4 hours until meat is very tender. To serve, sear skin-side down in hot pan until crispy.

Duck fat roasted potatoes.directions: Parboil quartered potatoes 10 minutes. Drain, rough up edges. Toss in hot duck fat with herbs. Roast at 425°F, turning occasionally, until golden and crispy, about 45 minutes.

Cassoulet.directions: Soak beans. Cook with bacon, garlic, herbs until almost tender. Layer in cassole with duck confit, sausage, pork. Top with breadcrumbs. Bake at 300°F 2-3 hours, breaking crust periodically.

Coq au vin.directions: Render bacon, remove. Brown chicken in fat. Remove. Sauté mushrooms and garlic. Add flour, cook 1 minute. Add wine, broth, tomato paste, thyme, bay leaf. Return chicken and bacon. Cover, braise at 325°F for 1.5 hours.

Boeuf bourguignon.directions: Render bacon. Brown beef in batches. Add wine, broth, tomato paste, herbs. Braise covered at 325°F 2-3 hours. Sauté mushrooms and pearl onions in butter. Add to stew. Thicken sauce if needed.

Beef daube Proven\u00e7al.directions: Brown beef cubes. Add wine, tomatoes, olives, orange zest, herbs, garlic. Braise covered at 300°F 3 hours until very tender. Sauce should be thick and flavorful.

Chicken fricassee.directions: Season chicken, dust with flour. Brown in butter 4 minutes per side. Add garlic, thyme, bay leaf. Add broth, cover, simmer 35 minutes. Remove chicken. Add cream, reduce until thickened. Return chicken, adjust seasoning.

Poulet r\u00f4ti.directions: Truss chicken, rub with softened butter under and over skin. Season generously. Stuff cavity with lemon and thyme. Roast at 425°F for 1 hour, basting with butter. Rest 15 minutes before carving.

Duck \u00e0 l'orange.directions: Score duck skin, season with salt and pepper. Start skin-side down in cold pan, render fat over medium heat 15 minutes. Flip, cook 5 minutes. Rest. Make sauce: caramelize sugar, add orange juice, broth, Grand Marnier, reduce. Swirl in butter. Slice duck, serve with sauce.

Steak au poivre with cognac cream.directions: Crush peppercorns, press into steaks. Sear in butter to desired doneness. Remove. Add shallots to pan, deglaze with cognac (carefully flame), add cream. Reduce until thick. Pour over steaks.

Steak Diane tableside.directions: Pound medallions thin. Sear in butter quickly. Remove. Sauté shallots and mushrooms. Add cognac, flame. Add Worcestershire, mustard, cream. Reduce. Return steaks briefly. Garnish with parsley.

Chateaubriand for two.directions: Season thick tenderloin (2+ inches). Sear all sides. Roast at 400°F to 125°F internal. Rest. Make pan sauce with wine, broth, shallots, thyme. Slice, serve with sauce and béarnaise.

Lobster thermidor.directions: Cook lobster tails, remove meat, reserve shells. Make sauce: roux, add milk, reduce. Off heat, whisk in yolks, cheese, mustard, sherry. Chop lobster, fold into sauce. Stuff back into shells. Top with more cheese. Broil until golden.

Lobster Newburg.directions: Sauté lobster chunks in butter. Add sherry, reduce. Mix cream with yolks. Lower heat, add cream mixture stirring constantly. Season with cayenne and nutmeg. Serve over toast points.

Shrimp de Jonghe.directions: Melt butter with garlic. Add sherry, cook 1 minute. Place shrimp in baking dish. Pour garlic butter over. Top with breadcrumbs mixed with parsley and paprika. Bake at 400°F 15-18 minutes until bubbly.

Oysters Rockefeller.directions: Sauté spinach with garlic in butter. Add Pernod, season. Top each oyster on half shell with spinach mixture, breadcrumbs, parmesan. Bake at 450°F 10-12 minutes until bubbly and golden.

Clams casino.directions: Shuck clams, loosen meat, leave on half shell. Mix soft butter with garlic, parsley, lemon juice. Top each clam with butter mixture, then breadcrumbs mixed with parmesan, then small piece of bacon. Broil until bacon is crispy and breadcrumbs golden.

Stuffed clams.directions: Steam clams open, reserve shells. Chop clam meat. Mix with sautéed garlic, breadcrumbs, bacon bits, parsley, lemon zest. Fill shells with mixture. Top with parmesan. Bake at 400°F until golden.

Mussels in white wine butter.directions: Clean and debeard mussels. Sauté shallots and garlic in butter. Add wine, bring to boil. Add mussels, cover, cook 5 minutes until opened. Add cream and parsley. Serve with crusty bread for soaking up broth.

Bouillabaisse.directions: Make broth with saffron, fennel, garlic, wine, and fish stock. Add firm fish first, cook 5 minutes. Add shellfish, cover until opened. Serve with crusty bread and rouille.

Cioppino.directions: Sauté garlic in oil. Add wine, reduce by half. Add tomatoes and broth, simmer 20 minutes. Add clams and mussels first, cover 5 minutes. Add shrimp, crab, fish. Cook 5 more minutes until everything is cooked. Season, garnish with basil.

New England clam chowder loaded.directions: Fry bacon, reserve fat. Sauté onion and celery in fat. Add flour, then clam juice and cream. Add potatoes, simmer until tender. Add clams and bacon. Season with thyme. Serve with oyster crackers.

Manhattan clam chowder.directions: Fry bacon, sauté onion and celery. Add crushed tomatoes, clam juice, potatoes, herbs. Simmer until potatoes tender. Add clams, cook until just heated. Season with hot sauce.

She-crab soup.directions: Make roux with butter and flour. Add broth, simmer. Add cream, sherry, Old Bay. Add crab meat and roe. Simmer 10 minutes. Season with salt and white pepper.

Crawfish \u00e9touff\u00e9e.directions: Make blonde roux: cook flour in butter 10 minutes until golden. Add garlic, Cajun seasoning, cayenne. Add broth, stir until smooth. Add crawfish, simmer 15 minutes. Season with salt. Serve over rice.

Shrimp and grits deluxe.directions: Cook grits in broth with cream. Stir in butter and cheese. Cook bacon and sausage. Sauté shrimp with garlic. Serve shrimp, bacon, sausage over grits. Garnish with green onions.

Shrimp Creole.directions: Make roux with butter and flour. Add garlic and Cajun seasoning. Add tomatoes and broth. Simmer 30 minutes. Add shrimp, cook 5 minutes until pink. Serve over rice.

Shrimp \u00e9touff\u00e9e.directions: Make blonde roux with butter and flour. Add garlic and Cajun seasoning. Add broth, stir until smooth. Add shrimp last 5 minutes. Serve over rice.

BBQ shrimp New Orleans style.directions: Melt 1 lb butter with Worcestershire, lemon juice, garlic, Creole seasoning, rosemary. Add head-on shrimp. Cook in butter sauce 8-10 minutes. Serve in bowls with lots of sauce and crusty bread.

Blackened redfish.directions: Coat fish heavily with butter then Cajun blackening spices. Heat cast iron until smoking hot. Cook 3-4 minutes per side until charred crust forms. The original blackened fish.

Blackened catfish.directions: Mix spices for blackening seasoning. Coat fish heavily with butter then seasoning. Cook in very hot cast iron pan 3-4 minutes per side. The spices should char but not burn.

Pecan-crusted trout.directions: Chop pecans finely, mix with flour. Dredge trout in flour, dip in egg, coat in pecans. Pan-fry in butter until golden and fish flakes. Serve with brown butter, lemon, and parsley.

Crab-stuffed flounder.directions: Mix crab with breadcrumbs, mayo, Dijon, Old Bay. Place stuffing on fillets, roll. Bake at 375°F with butter 20-25 minutes until fish flakes. Serve with lemon.

Crab imperial.directions: Gently fold crab with mayo, egg, Dijon, Worcestershire, Old Bay. Place in ramekins or crab shells. Top with buttered breadcrumbs. Bake at 375°F 20-25 minutes until golden and heated through.

Crab Norfolk.directions: Sauté crab gently in butter. Add wine, lemon juice, Worcestershire. Heat through without breaking up crab. Garnish with parsley. Virginia classic.

Deviled crab.directions: Make béchamel, add mustard, cayenne. Fold in crab. Stuff into clean crab shells. Top with buttered breadcrumbs. Bake at 375°F 20 minutes until golden.

Soft shell crab sandwich.directions: Clean soft shell crabs, removing gills and apron. Dredge in seasoned flour. Pan-fry in butter until crispy on both sides. Serve on toasted brioche with remoulade, lettuce, tomato, and lemon.

Soft shell crab amandine.directions: Clean crabs. Dredge in seasoned flour. Pan-fry in butter until golden. Remove. Toast almonds in same butter until golden. Add lemon juice and parsley. Pour almond butter over crabs.

Alligator bites.directions: Cut alligator into bite-sized pieces. Marinate in buttermilk 2 hours. Season flour with Cajun seasoning. Dredge and fry at 350°F until golden, about 4 minutes.

Frog legs.directions: Season frog legs with salt and pepper, dust with flour. Sauté in butter until golden and cooked through, about 4-5 minutes per side. Add garlic last minute. Finish with lemon juice and parsley.

Chicken and waffles.directions: Make waffles: mix flour, baking powder, salt. Add milk, egg, melted butter. Cook in waffle iron. Marinate chicken in buttermilk 4 hours. Season flour with salt, pepper, cayenne. Dredge and fry at 350°F 10-12 minutes. Serve chicken on waffles with maple syrup.

Chicken and waffles with hot chicken.directions: Make Nashville hot chicken: buttermilk marinate, flour dredge, fry, brush with cayenne-sugar-lard paste. Make waffles. Stack hot chicken on waffle. Drizzle maple syrup.

Biscuits and gravy with sausage patties.directions: Make gravy with sausage drippings. Form and cook sausage patties separately. Split biscuits, ladle gravy over, crown with sausage patties.

Country ham and red-eye gravy.directions: Pan-fry country ham in butter. Remove. Add strong coffee and brown sugar to drippings, simmer to make red-eye gravy. Serve ham with gravy, fried eggs, and grits.

Chicken-fried chicken with white gravy.directions: Pound chicken, marinate in buttermilk. Double-dredge in seasoned flour. Fry until golden. For gravy: add 3 tbsp flour to pan drippings, cook 1 minute. Whisk in 2 cups milk, simmer until thick. Season generously with pepper. Pour over chicken.

Smothered pork chops in onion gravy.directions: Season chops, dredge in flour. Brown in butter, remove. Caramelize sliced onions in drippings. Add flour, cook 1 minute. Add broth. Return chops. Cover, simmer 40 minutes until chops are very tender.

Smothered chicken.directions: Season chicken with salt and pepper. Brown in butter 4 minutes per side. Remove. Add flour, cook 1 minute. Add broth, cream, thyme, garlic. Return chicken. Cover, simmer 30 minutes until chicken is tender.

Country captain chicken.directions: Brown chicken. Add curry powder, cook 30 seconds. Add tomatoes and broth. Simmer 30 minutes. Add raisins. Serve over rice, topped with toasted almonds.

Hot brown.directions: Make Mornay: roux with butter and flour, add milk, stir in parmesan until smooth. Toast bread in baking dish. Top with sliced turkey. Cover with Mornay sauce. Top with bacon. Broil until bubbly and browned.

Horseshoe sandwich.directions: Toast Texas toast. Make cheese sauce: melt cheese with butter and milk. Grill burger patty. Stack: toast, patty, pile of French fries, smother in cheese sauce.

Jibarito.directions: Slice plantains, fry until golden, flatten with tostonera, fry again until crispy. Season steak with cumin, garlic, salt. Grill or pan-fry to desired doneness, slice thin. Spread garlic mayo on plantain, add steak, cheese, another plantain on top.

Flint coney.directions: Make Flint coney sauce: ground beef heart cooked to fine crumbles with spices. Grill hot dogs. Steam buns. Top with meat sauce, mustard, diced onion. Michigan classic.

Skyline chili cheese fries.directions: Make Cincinnati-style chili: simmer beef with chili powder, cinnamon, cumin, allspice, and water. Serve crispy fries topped with chili, shredded cheddar, diced onion, and beans.

Chili size.directions: Cook hamburger patty. Place on open-faced bun. Top with chili and shredded cheese. Add diced onion. California diner classic.

Frito pie supreme.directions: Pile Fritos on plate or serve in bag. Top with hot chili and shredded cheese. Add jalapeños, sour cream, guacamole, pico de gallo. Ultimate loaded version.

Walking taco.directions: Brown beef with taco seasoning. Open small Fritos bag from side. Add seasoned beef, shredded cheese, lettuce, tomato, sour cream, salsa. Eat directly from bag with fork.

Taco pizza.directions: Stretch dough on pan. Spread refried beans. Top with seasoned cooked beef and shredded cheddar. Bake at 425°F 15-18 minutes. Top with jalapeños, dollops of sour cream, and salsa.

Mexican pizza.directions: Cook beef with taco seasoning. Fry tortillas until crispy. Spread beans on one tortilla, add beef, top with another tortilla. Spread enchilada sauce and cheese on top. Bake at 400°F 10 minutes until cheese melts. Top with sour cream.

Navajo taco.directions: Make frybread: mix flour, baking powder, salt, milk. Roll into rounds, fry until golden and puffed. Top with refried beans, seasoned beef, cheese, sour cream.

Frybread.directions: Mix 2 cups flour, 1 tbsp baking powder, 1 tsp salt. Add 3/4 cup warm milk to form soft dough. Rest 30 minutes. Divide and roll into 6-inch circles. Fry in hot oil (375°F) until golden and puffed, about 2 minutes per side.

Sonoran hot dog.directions: Wrap hot dogs in bacon, grill until bacon is crispy. Warm beans. Split bolillo bread. Spread mayo, add beans, bacon-wrapped hot dog, chopped tomatoes, jalapeños, mustard.

Danger dog.directions: Wrap hot dogs in bacon, grill until bacon is crispy. Toast buns. Add dog with grilled onions, sliced jalapeños, mayo, mustard, ketchup. LA street food classic.

Seattle hot dog.directions: Grill hot dogs. Toast buns. Spread generous cream cheese on bun. Add hot dog. Top with grilled jalapeños and sriracha.

Chicago hot dog.directions: Boil or steam hot dogs. Toast buns. Apply mustard, relish, tomato, pickle spear, sport peppers, celery salt. No ketchup - this is Chicago. Order at will!

Corn dog with fancy mustards.directions: Make corndog batter. Insert sticks, coat dogs in batter. Fry at 365°F until golden. Serve with variety of fancy mustards for dipping.

Pigs in blanket with everything bagel se.directions: Roll each mini hot dog in crescent dough triangle. Brush with melted butter. Sprinkle generously with everything bagel seasoning. Bake at 375°F for 12-15 minutes until golden. Serve with mustard.

Bacon-wrapped dates stuffed with cheese.directions: Pit dates, stuff with goat cheese. Wrap each with half strip bacon, secure with toothpick. Bake at 400°F 15-20 minutes until bacon is crispy. Season with pepper.

Devils on horseback.directions: Stuff dates with blue cheese. Wrap each in half strip bacon. Secure with toothpicks. Bake at 400°F 15-20 minutes until bacon is crispy. Remove picks before serving.

Pimento cheese.directions: Grate cheddar, mix with softened cream cheese and mayo. Fold in drained chopped pimentos, minced garlic, cayenne, Worcestershire, salt. Chill before serving with crackers or as a spread.

Beer cheese.directions: Shred cheddar. Melt cream cheese, stir in cheddar. Add beer gradually while stirring. Season with garlic powder, Worcestershire, mustard, cayenne. Serve warm with pretzels.

Pub cheese.directions: Blend cheddar, cream cheese, splash of beer, garlic powder, Worcestershire, mustard, and cayenne until smooth. Chill for 2 hours for flavors to meld. Serve with soft pretzels or crackers.

Hot crab dip.directions: Mix soft cream cheese with mayo, Worcestershire, Old Bay, garlic. Fold in crab and half the cheddar. Transfer to baking dish. Top with remaining cheese. Bake at 350°F 25 minutes until bubbly. Serve with crackers.

Buffalo chicken dip.directions: Cook and shred chicken. Mix with cream cheese, hot sauce, ranch, half the cheddar. Transfer to baking dish. Top with remaining cheese. Bake at 350°F 25 minutes until bubbly. Serve with chips.

Queso fundido.directions: Cook chorizo until crispy. Put in small cast iron skillet with shredded Oaxaca cheese. Broil until cheese is melted and bubbly. Top with sliced jalapeño. Serve immediately with warm tortillas.
