Queso flameado.directions: Brown crumbled chorizo with diced onion and poblano. Place shredded Oaxaca cheese in cast iron skillet. Bake at 400°F until melted and bubbly. Top with chorizo mixture. Serve with warm tortillas.

Loaded queso.directions: Brown beef, add taco seasoning. Cube Velveeta, melt with milk and Rotel over low heat, stirring. Add cooked beef and sliced jalapeños. Serve hot with chips.

Brisket queso.directions: Chop smoked brisket finely. Cube Velveeta, melt with milk and Rotel. Fold in brisket and sliced jalapeños. Serve warm with tortilla chips.

Brisket nachos.directions: Chop smoked brisket. Layer chips with brisket and warm queso. Top with jalapeños, pickled onions. Drizzle with BBQ sauce. Serve with sour cream.

Irish nachos.directions: Slice potatoes thin, fry until crispy. Layer on sheet pan, top with shredded cheese and bacon bits. Broil until cheese melts. Drizzle with ranch and sour cream, garnish with scallions.

Totchos.directions: Bake tots until extra crispy. Brown beef with taco seasoning. Layer tots on plate, top with beef, cheese, broil to melt. Add jalapeños, sour cream, salsa, and guacamole.

Waffle fry nachos supreme.directions: Bake waffle fries until crispy. Brown beef with taco seasoning. Pile fries high, top with beef, drizzle cheese sauce. Add jalapeños, tomatoes, olives, scallions, and sour cream.

Potato skins loaded.directions: Bake potatoes until tender. Halve, scoop out most of flesh. Brush skins with butter, bake until crispy. Fill with cheese and bacon. Bake until cheese melts. Top with sour cream and scallions.

Twice-baked potatoes stuffed high.directions: Bake potatoes, halve and scoop flesh. Mash flesh with butter, sour cream, milk, half the cheese. Pile high back into skins. Top with remaining cheese and bacon. Bake until golden. Garnish with chives.

Hasselback loaded potatoes.directions: Slice potatoes thinly across the top, leaving bottom intact. Brush with melted butter, season. Bake at 425°F for 45 minutes. Insert cheese and bacon between slices. Bake until cheese melts. Top with sour cream, chives.

Baked potato soup in bread bowl.directions: Make loaded potato soup: cook bacon, make roux, add broth, cream, potatoes. Simmer until thick. Add cheese. Hollow out bread bowls. Fill with soup. Top with sour cream, bacon, cheese.

Loaded mashed potato cakes.directions: Mix cold mashed potatoes with cheese, bacon bits, scallions, egg, and flour. Form into patties. Pan-fry in butter until golden and crispy on both sides. Serve topped with sour cream.

Pommes dauphine.directions: Make mashed potatoes. Make choux: boil water with butter, add flour, stir until ball forms, beat in eggs one at a time. Mix equal parts mash and choux. Shape into balls. Fry at 350°F until golden and puffed.

Potato galette.directions: Slice potatoes very thin (mandoline). Melt butter in oven-safe skillet. Layer potatoes in overlapping circles, brushing each layer with butter, seasoning with salt, pepper, thyme. Cover, bake at 400°F 40 minutes. Uncover, broil to brown top.

R\u00f6sti.directions: Parboil potatoes, let cool completely. Grate coarsely. Season with salt and pepper. Melt butter in nonstick pan. Add potatoes in even layer, press firmly. Cook 10-12 minutes per side until golden and crispy throughout.

Latkes.directions: Grate potatoes, squeeze out all moisture. Mix with beaten egg, flour, salt, pepper. Form patties. Fry in 1/4 inch oil until golden and crispy, 4-5 minutes per side. Drain on rack. Serve with sour cream and applesauce.

Latkes with cr\u00e8me fra\u00eeche and.directions: Grate potatoes and onion, squeeze dry. Mix with eggs, flour, salt, pepper. Form patties, fry in oil until golden and crispy. Top each latke with crème fraîche, caviar, and chives.

Potato pierogi with brown butter and bac.directions: Make dough with flour, egg, sour cream, salt. Fill with mashed potato-cheese mixture. Boil, then pan-fry in butter until golden. Top with brown butter, crispy bacon bits, and caramelized onion.

Loaded pierogi casserole.directions: Layer frozen pierogies in baking dish. Top with caramelized onions, bacon bits, and shredded cheese. Drizzle with melted butter. Bake at 375°F for 35 minutes. Serve with sour cream and scallions.

Gnocchi in brown butter sage.directions: Cook gnocchi until they float. Pan-fry in butter until golden. Meanwhile, brown more butter until nutty and amber colored. Add sage leaves, fry until crispy. Toss gnocchi in brown butter, top with parmesan, salt, pepper.

Gnocchi alla vodka.directions: Cook gnocchi. Sauté garlic and red pepper flakes in butter. Add tomato paste, cook 2 minutes. Add vodka, simmer 3 minutes. Add cream, simmer 5 minutes. Toss with gnocchi and parmesan.

Fried gnocchi with parmesan.directions: Boil gnocchi until they float. Drain well, pat dry. Pan-fry in butter over medium-high heat until golden and crispy on all sides. Add minced garlic and sage last minute. Toss with parmesan, salt, and pepper.

Gnocchi mac and cheese.directions: Cook gnocchi. Make cheese sauce: melt butter, add flour, cook 1 minute. Add milk, simmer. Add cream cheese and cheddar, stir until smooth. Season with garlic powder, salt, pepper. Toss with gnocchi.

Shepherd's pie with lamb and Guinness.directions: Brown lamb with onion and carrots. Add Guinness, broth, tomato paste, thyme. Simmer until thick. Transfer to baking dish. Top with mashed potatoes, rough up with fork. Bake at 400°F until golden.

Cottage pie with bone marrow gravy.directions: Make mashed potatoes. Brown beef. Roast marrow bones, add marrow to gravy with broth and Worcestershire. Top filling with mash. Bake at 400°F until golden.

Bangers and mash with onion... skip onio.directions: Boil potatoes, mash with butter and milk. Cook sausages until browned and cooked through. Make gravy: deglaze pan with broth, thicken with flour slurry. Serve sausages on mash with gravy.

Toad in the hole with extra crispy batte.directions: Make batter with flour, eggs, milk, salt. Rest 30 minutes. Heat drippings in pan until smoking, add sausages. Brown, then pour batter around them. Bake at 425°F for 35 minutes until puffed and golden. Serve with onion gravy.

Full English minus the veg.directions: Fry bacon until crispy. Pan-fry sausages until browned and cooked through. Fry black pudding slices. Warm beans. Fry eggs in bacon fat. Toast bread, butter it. Arrange everything on a plate.

Black pudding scotch egg.directions: Soft boil eggs. Mix crumbled black pudding with sausage. Wrap each egg. Dredge in flour, egg, breadcrumbs. Fry at 350°F 6-7 minutes until cooked through.

Scotch egg with runny yolk.directions: Soft-boil eggs 6 minutes, cool in ice bath. Peel carefully. Season sausage meat with mace and sage. Wrap each egg in thin layer of meat. Coat in flour, egg, breadcrumbs. Deep fry at 350°F for 4 minutes. Serve with mustard.

Beef Wellington individual portions.directions: Sear medallions, brush with mustard. Wrap each in mushroom duxelles and prosciutto. Wrap in puff pastry. Brush with egg wash. Bake at 425°F 20-25 minutes until golden.

Pork Wellington.directions: Sear seasoned tenderloin. Finely chop mushrooms, cook until dry. Spread mustard on pork. Layer: plastic wrap, prosciutto, mushrooms. Place pork, roll tight. Wrap in puff pastry. Brush with egg. Bake at 425°F 25-30 minutes.

Chicken Kiev.directions: Make garlic-herb butter: mix soft butter with garlic and parsley, freeze. Pound chicken thin. Wrap butter in chicken, roll tight. Freeze 30 min. Dredge in flour, egg, breadcrumbs. Fry at 350°F 8-10 minutes until golden and cooked. Butter should ooze when cut.

Chicken cordon bleu.directions: Pound chicken thin. Layer ham and Swiss on chicken, roll up tightly. Secure with toothpicks. Dredge in flour, egg, breadcrumbs. Pan-fry in butter 4 minutes per side until golden. Finish in 400°F oven 15 minutes. Remove picks before serving.

Stuffed chicken breast with boursin.directions: Cut pocket in chicken breast. Stuff with Boursin. Wrap with prosciutto. Secure with toothpicks. Season. Sear in oil, then bake at 375°F 20-25 minutes until cooked through. Remove picks.

Bacon explosion.directions: Weave bacon into mat. Spread sausage over bacon, leaving border. Sprinkle with rub and cooked crumbled bacon. Roll tightly. Coat with rub. Smoke at 250°F 2.5 hours. Glaze with BBQ sauce, smoke 30 more minutes.

Fatty melt.directions: Make two grilled cheese sandwiches. Cook bacon and beef patty. Use the grilled cheeses as buns for the bacon cheeseburger. Peak indulgence.

Bacon weave BLT minus LT.directions: Weave 6-8 strips of bacon into a square. Bake at 400°F until crispy. Toast bread with butter. Spread mayo. Place bacon weave between bread slices.

Million dollar bacon.directions: Line sheet pan with foil. Arrange bacon. Mix brown sugar, maple syrup, cayenne, black pepper. Spread mixture on bacon. Bake at 400°F 20-25 minutes until caramelized and crispy. Cool slightly (sugar is molten hot).

Pig candy.directions: Line bacon strips on rack over sheet pan. Coat generously with brown sugar, black pepper, and cayenne. Bake at 375°F for 25-30 minutes until caramelized and crispy. Cool completely before serving.

Pork belly burnt ends.directions: Cube pork belly. Coat with BBQ rub. Smoke at 250°F 2 hours. Toss with brown sugar, butter, BBQ sauce, honey, vinegar. Return to smoker in pan 1.5 hours, stirring occasionally, until glazed and caramelized.

Brisket burnt ends.directions: Smoke whole brisket until done. Separate the point. Cube into 1-inch pieces. Toss with BBQ sauce, brown sugar, butter, honey. Return to smoker in pan 2 hours, stirring occasionally until caramelized.

Poor man's burnt ends.directions: Season chuck roast with rub. Smoke at 275°F for 3 hours. Cube into 2-inch pieces. Toss with butter, honey, BBQ sauce. Smoke uncovered 2 more hours, stirring occasionally until caramelized.

Smoked chuck roast.directions: Apply rub generously to chuck roast. Smoke at 250°F until internal temp reaches 165°F. Wrap in foil with broth. Continue until 203°F. Rest 30 minutes. Slice or pull and serve with juices.

Smoked beef cheeks.directions: Trim beef cheeks, season well. Smoke at 250°F for 4 hours until bark forms. Braise in broth and wine at 275°F for 3 more hours until fork tender. Rest 20 minutes. Slice against grain.

Smoked oxtail.directions: Season oxtail with rub. Smoke at 250°F for 3 hours. Braise in broth, wine, tomato paste, garlic, onion, thyme for 4 hours until meat falls off bone. Serve with braising liquid.

Smoked short ribs.directions: Season short ribs with rub. Smoke bone-side down at 275°F for 6-8 hours until meat probes like butter (203°F). Rest 30 minutes before serving.

Dino ribs.directions: Apply heavy layer of salt, pepper, and rub. Smoke at 275°F 6-8 hours until probe tender. Spritz with vinegar occasionally. These massive ribs need low and slow.

Beef back ribs.directions: Remove membrane from ribs. Apply rub generously. Smoke at 250°F 5-6 hours, spritzing with vinegar occasionally. Ribs are done when probe tender. Optional: glaze with BBQ sauce last 30 minutes.

Smoked prime rib.directions: Season roast with salt, pepper, herbs. Smoke at 225°F until internal temp reaches 120°F for medium-rare. Rest 30 minutes. Sear in hot cast iron with butter. Slice and serve with horseradish cream.

Smoked tri-tip Santa Maria style.directions: Season tri-tip with Santa Maria rub. Smoke at 225°F until internal temp reaches 130°F. Sear over high heat to develop crust. Rest 10 minutes. Slice thin against the grain.

Picanha on the spit.directions: Keep fat cap on picanha. Slice into thick steaks following the grain. Skewer on rotisserie spit in C-shape. Salt generously. Rotisserie cook over coals, slicing outer layer as it cooks. Serve with lime and farofa.

Churrasco mixed grill.directions: Season all meats with coarse salt. Grill over various heat levels appropriate for each cut. Serve on wooden board with chimichurri. Brazilian churrasco feast.

Gaucho steak with chimichurri.directions: Make chimichurri: chop parsley and oregano, mix with garlic, vinegar, oil, pepper flakes. Salt steak generously. Grill over high heat to desired doneness. Slice, serve with chimichurri.

Asado-style short ribs.directions: Season short ribs generously with coarse salt and pepper. Grill over low indirect heat 2-3 hours until tender. Baste with fat drippings. Serve with chimichurri.

Vacio steak.directions: Season vacio with coarse salt. Grill over high heat, fat side down first. Flip and cook to medium. Rest 10 minutes. Slice thin against grain. Serve with chimichurri and lemon wedges.

Entra\u00f1a.directions: Season skirt steak generously with coarse salt. Grill over high heat 3-4 minutes per side for medium-rare. Rest. Slice against grain. Serve with chimichurri. Argentine favorite.

Provoleta.directions: Place thick slice of provolone in small cast iron skillet. Top with oregano and red pepper flakes. Grill or broil until cheese is melted and bottom is crispy. Drizzle with olive oil. Serve with bread.

Choripan with extra crispy chorizo.directions: Grill chorizo, butterfly, grill cut-side down until extra crispy. Melt provolone on bread. Add chorizo, generous chimichurri and salsa criolla.

Empanadas fritas.directions: Make empanada dough. Fill with seasoned beef and chopped eggs. Seal and crimp edges. Deep fry at 350°F until golden and puffed. Drain on paper towels.

Sopes with carnitas.directions: Make thick masa patties, cook on griddle. Pinch up edges to form shallow cups. Fill with refried beans, crispy carnitas, salsa, crema, cheese, lettuce, and onion.

Huaraches loaded.directions: Make masa dough, form into sandal-shaped thick tortillas with layer of black beans pressed inside. Cook on griddle. Top with sliced carne asada, salsa verde, crema, cheese, onion, cilantro.

Tlayuda.directions: Spread large tortilla with asiento (pork lard) and refried beans. Top with shredded Oaxaca cheese. Toast on griddle until crispy. Add grilled tasajo, avocado, salsa. Fold in half or serve flat.

Mulita.directions: Season and cook carne asada, slice thin. Layer cheese and meat between two tortillas. Grill on each side until tortillas crispy and cheese melts. Top with cilantro and squeeze of lime.

Vampiro taco.directions: Press corn tortilla on flat griddle until edges are crispy. Add shredded Oaxaca cheese to melt. Top with chopped carne asada. Fold and top with guacamole, salsa, onion, cilantro.

Birria tacos with consomm\u00e9 three wa.directions: Dip tortillas in consommé and griddle. Fill with meat and cheese. Serve tacos with: warm consommé for dipping, consommé as soup, and consommé-brushed tortillas for different textures.

Barbacoa cheeks.directions: Toast and rehydrate chilies. Blend with spices, garlic, vinegar. Brown beef cheeks. Cover with sauce and broth. Braise covered at 300°F 5 hours until tender. Shred.

Lengua tacos.directions: Simmer tongue with onion, garlic, bay leaf for 3 hours until tender. Peel membrane, dice meat. Brown on griddle. Serve in tortillas with cilantro, onion, salsa verde, and lime.

Cabeza tacos.directions: Braise beef head meat until very tender (from a taqueria, or slow cook yourself 6-8 hours). Chop. Serve in warm tortillas with cilantro, onion, lime, salsa verde.

Suadero tacos.directions: Slice brisket thin. Confit in lard at low temperature until very tender. Brown pieces on hot griddle until crispy edges. Serve in warm tortillas with onion, cilantro, salsa, and lime.

Trompo al pastor at home.directions: Blend soaked guajillos with achiote, pineapple juice, vinegar. Marinate thin-sliced pork overnight. Stack on vertical spit if available or roast. Slice off edges as they crisp. Serve with pineapple, onion, cilantro.

Cochinita pibil.directions: Blend achiote paste with orange juice, lime juice, garlic, cumin, oregano. Marinate pork overnight. Wrap in banana leaves (or foil). Slow roast at 300°F for 4-5 hours until falling apart. Shred, serve with pickled red onions and tortillas.

Chile colorado.directions: Toast and rehydrate chilies. Blend with garlic, cumin, oregano, some broth. Brown cubed beef. Add chile sauce and remaining broth. Simmer 2-3 hours until beef is tender and sauce thick.

Carne adovada.directions: Toast and rehydrate chilies. Blend with garlic, oregano, cumin, vinegar. Cube pork, cover with chile sauce. Braise covered at 300°F 3-4 hours until very tender. Sauce should be thick and rich.

Green chile stew.directions: Cube pork, brown in batches. Add garlic, cook 30 seconds. Add diced green chiles, cubed potatoes, broth, cumin. Simmer 1.5 hours until pork is tender. Thicken with flour slurry if desired. Season with salt.

Posole rojo.directions: Toast and rehydrate dried chilies, blend with garlic into paste. Brown cubed pork. Add chile paste, water, and hominy. Simmer 2-3 hours until pork is tender. Season with salt and oregano. Serve with shredded cabbage and lime.

Posole verde.directions: Simmer pork until tender. Shred. Roast and blend tomatillos, peppers, garlic, onion. Add salsa to broth with hominy. Simmer 30 minutes. Serve with cabbage, radish, lime, oregano.

Menudo.directions: Clean and boil tripe for 3+ hours until tender. Toast and blend chiles with garlic. Add chile sauce to broth with hominy. Simmer 1 hour. Serve with oregano, lime, cilantro, and tortillas.

Birria ramen fusion.directions: Heat consommé with additional seasonings if desired. Cook ramen noodles. Soft-boil eggs 6.5 minutes. Assemble: noodles in consommé, topped with birria, halved egg, cilantro, nori. Serve with lime.

Birria grilled cheese deluxe.directions: Dip bread in consommé. Layer Oaxaca, mozzarella, generous birria. Butter outside. Grill until extremely crispy with cheese oozing. Serve with consommé garnished with cilantro.

Birria pizza.directions: Stretch dough. Brush with consommé. Top with shredded Oaxaca and mozzarella. Add birria meat. Bake at 475°F until crust is golden. Top with fresh cilantro. Serve with consommé for dipping.

Mexican street corn pizza.directions: Spread dough, top with elote sauce (mayo-based) and mozzarella. Add corn kernels. Bake at 500°F until crust is golden. Top with crumbled cotija, cilantro, crema drizzle, chili powder, lime zest.

Carne asada fries.directions: Grill and slice carne asada. Fry crispy French fries. Top with hot fries, meat, shredded cheese (melt under broiler), guacamole, sour cream, pico de gallo.

California burrito.directions: Grill carne asada, slice thin. Fill large tortilla with meat, hot fries, cheese, sour cream, guacamole, pico de gallo. Roll burrito style. The French fries inside are essential.

Surf and turf burrito.directions: Grill carne asada and sear shrimp. Slice steak thin. Warm tortilla, layer rice, beans, cheese, steak, shrimp, guacamole. Roll burrito. Serve with salsa and sour cream.

Burrito bowl with all the meats.directions: Prepare each meat separately. Layer rice and beans in bowl. Top with all the meats, cheese, sour cream, guacamole, and salsa. The ultimate protein bowl.

Nachos with smoked brisket and queso.directions: Chop brisket into pieces. Make queso: melt Velveeta with Rotel. Layer chips, brisket, hot queso. Top with jalapeños, pickled onions, cilantro.

Queso birria nachos.directions: Shred birria meat. Layer chips with cheese, birria. Bake until cheese melts. Drizzle with consomé. Top with onion and cilantro. Serve with consomé for dipping and lime wedges.

Chilaquiles with carnitas.directions: Simmer salsa with chips until slightly softened. Top with crispy carnitas, fried egg, crumbled queso fresco, drizzle of crema, fresh cilantro.

Chilaquiles divorciados.directions: Place chips on plate. Cover one half with salsa verde, other half with salsa roja. Top each side with fried egg. Add crema and queso fresco. Garnish with cilantro.

Migas with chorizo.directions: Remove chorizo from casing, cook until browned. Add crushed tortilla chips. Beat eggs, pour over mixture. Scramble together. Fold in cheese while eggs are still slightly wet. Serve with salsa.

Machaca con huevo.directions: Rehydrate machaca if dried. Scramble eggs. Add machaca to eggs while still wet, cook together until eggs are set. Serve with warm tortillas and salsa.

Huevos rancheros stacked.directions: Fry tortillas until slightly crispy. Stack with layer of beans, fried egg, ranchero sauce on each. Top with queso fresco, sliced avocado, crema drizzle, and cilantro.

Huevos divorciados.directions: Fry two eggs. Place on tortilla with refried beans in center. Top one egg with salsa verde, other with salsa roja. Add beans as divider. Garnish with queso fresco and crema.

Molletes loaded.directions: Split bolillos, toast cut-side up. Spread with refried beans. Top with cooked chorizo and shredded cheese. Broil until cheese melts. Top with pico de gallo, crema, and avocado.

Torta ahogada.directions: Split crusty birote roll. Spread with beans, fill with carnitas. Drown (ahogada) the torta in spicy chile de arbol tomato sauce. Top with sliced onion, oregano, and lime juice.

Torta cubana.directions: Split telera, spread with beans. Layer milanesa, sliced hot dog, ham, cooked chorizo, melted cheese. Top with avocado and pickled jalapeños. Press and grill until crusty.

Cemita.directions: Make beef milanesa. Toast sesame bun. Spread refried beans and chipotles. Layer milanesa, sliced avocado, melted Oaxaca cheese, papalo herb. A massive, perfect sandwich.

Pambazo.directions: Make filling with crumbled chorizo and cubed potatoes. Dip bread in guajillo chile sauce. Griddle in oil until crispy. Fill with chorizo-potato mixture. Top with lettuce, crema, and cheese.

Gordita stuffed thick.directions: Make thick masa patties with lard. Griddle until cooked. Slice open to make pocket. Stuff generously with carnitas, beans, cheese, crema, salsa verde.

Picaditas.directions: Make thick masa patties, cook on griddle. While warm, pinch up edges to form rim. Add salsa and beans. Top with crumbled queso fresco, crema, and diced onion.

Chalupas.directions: Make masa boats, fry until crispy. Top with shredded pork, salsa verde, crumbled queso fresco, drizzle of sour cream.

Tostada tower.directions: Stack tostadas with refried beans, shredded chicken, lettuce, crema, cheese between each layer. Build 3-4 layers high. Top with avocado and salsa verde. Eat by breaking off sections.

Flautas.directions: Roll seasoned shredded chicken tightly in corn tortillas. Secure with toothpicks. Fry at 350°F until golden and crispy all over. Remove picks. Serve with sour cream, guacamole, crumbled queso fresco.

Taquitos dorados.directions: Fill tortillas with shredded seasoned chicken. Roll tightly, secure with toothpicks. Fry until golden and crispy. Remove picks. Top with crema, cheese, lettuce, salsa, and jalapeños.

Enchiladas suizas.directions: Blend roasted tomatillos with cream, broth, garlic, salt. Dip tortillas in sauce to soften. Fill with chicken and cheese, roll. Place in baking dish, cover with sauce and more cheese. Bake at 375°F 20 minutes. Drizzle with sour cream.

Enchiladas mole.directions: Dissolve mole paste in warm chicken broth. Dip tortillas in warm mole to soften. Fill with shredded chicken and cheese, roll. Place seam-down in baking dish. Pour remaining mole over top. Bake at 375°F 20 minutes. Top with sour cream, sesame seeds.

Mole negro.directions: Toast and rehydrate multiple dried chiles. Blend with toasted nuts, seeds, chocolate, spices, charred onion and garlic. Simmer with chicken broth for 1 hour. Serve over chicken with rice.

Mole rojo over chicken.directions: Toast and rehydrate chiles. Blend with roasted tomatoes, toasted almonds, raisins, onion, garlic, spices. Simmer sauce, add chocolate until melted. Braise chicken in mole. Serve with rice.

Pipi\u00e1n.directions: Toast pepitas until they pop. Blend with roasted tomatillos, serrano, onion, garlic, cumin. Simmer sauce. Add braised pork, simmer together. Serve over rice with cilantro.

Adobo-braised chicken.directions: Brown chicken in oil. Add soy sauce, vinegar, garlic, bay leaves, peppercorns, and 1/2 cup water. Simmer covered 30-40 minutes until tender. Uncover, reduce sauce until thickened.

Pollo en crema.directions: Season chicken, brown in butter 4 minutes per side. Remove. Sauté garlic. Add broth and cream. Return chicken, simmer 25 minutes until cooked through and sauce thickens. Serve over rice.

Tinga de pollo.directions: Simmer chicken in broth until cooked. Shred. Blend tomatoes with chipotles, garlic, oregano, cumin. Simmer sauce 15 minutes. Add shredded chicken. Cook 10 more minutes. Serve in tacos or tostadas.

Mixiotes.directions: Make adobo by blending soaked chiles with spices, garlic, onion. Marinate lamb in adobo overnight. Wrap in parchment with avocado leaf. Steam for 3 hours until very tender.

Alambre without peppers.directions: Cube beef, season with cumin and salt. Cook bacon until crispy, remove. Stir-fry beef in bacon fat. Top with melted Oaxaca cheese and crumbled bacon. Serve with warm tortillas.

Carne en su jugo.directions: Cook bacon until crispy. Brown cubed beef. Blend tomatillos, serranos, cilantro. Add to beef with broth and beans. Simmer 30 minutes. Serve soupy with bacon on top.

Asado de boda.directions: Toast and rehydrate chilies. Blend with chocolate, spices, garlic, vinegar. Brown cubed pork. Add sauce, simmer covered 2 hours until pork is very tender and sauce thickens.

Carnitas Michoac\u00e1n style.directions: Cube pork, season with salt. Cook slowly in lard with orange juice, evaporated milk, Coca-Cola, and bay leaves until liquid evaporates and pork crisps in remaining fat. Traditional and delicious.

Chicharr\u00f3n in salsa verde.directions: Roast tomatillos and serranos. Blend with garlic and broth. Break chicharrones into pieces. Simmer in salsa verde until slightly softened but still textured. Serve with tortillas.

Chicharr\u00f3n prensado tacos.directions: Heat and crumble pressed chicharrón. Warm tortillas. Fill with chicharrón. Top with salsa verde, chopped cilantro and onion. Squeeze lime over top.

Fried chicharrones fresh.directions: Score and dry pork skin overnight. Simmer in water 2 hours. Cool, scrape off fat. Dry completely. Deep fry at 375°F until puffed and crispy. Season with salt. Serve with lime and hot sauce.

Chicharrones preparados.directions: Top large piece of chicharrón with cueritos (pickled pork skin), shredded cabbage, lime juice, hot sauce, sour cream, crumbled queso fresco. Mexican street food at its finest.

Cuban mojo pork with extra garlic.directions: Blend marinade with lots of garlic (a whole head). Marinate pork overnight. Slow roast at 300°F 4-5 hours. Shred, crisp edges under broiler. Extra garlicky and delicious.

Cuban sandwich pressed paper thin.directions: Assemble classic Cuban sandwich. Press in plancha or with heavy weight until extremely flat and all cheese is melted and bread is super crispy. Maximum crunch.

Medianoche on sweet bread.directions: Split sweet bread, spread with mustard. Layer roast pork, ham, Swiss cheese, and pickles. Butter outside. Press in sandwich press until bread is golden and cheese is melted.

Pan con lech\u00f3n.directions: Split Cuban bread. Pile high with shredded mojo-marinated roast pork. Drizzle with mojo sauce (garlic, citrus, olive oil). Top with sliced onion. Press lightly and serve warm.

Vaca frita.directions: Simmer flank steak until tender, 2 hours. Shred. Marinate in lime juice and garlic. Pan-fry in hot oil until very crispy edges. Season with salt and pepper. Serve with rice and black beans.

Ropa vieja.directions: Braise flank steak in broth with bay leaf until very tender, 2-3 hours. Shred meat. Sauté garlic, add tomatoes, cumin, oregano. Add shredded beef, simmer 20 minutes. Season with salt. Serve with rice and black beans.

Arroz con pollo amarillo.directions: Brown chicken. Add garlic, cumin, tomato sauce. Add rice, saffron-infused broth. Simmer covered until rice is tender. Add olives and peas last 5 minutes.

Arroz imperial.directions: Cook rice. Cook and shred chicken. Mix mayo with cream cheese. Layer: rice, mayo mixture, chicken, ham, cheese. Repeat. Bake at 375°F 25 minutes until cheese bubbles.

Pernil slow roasted.directions: Make adobo with garlic, oregano, cumin, oil, vinegar, citrus. Pierce pork deeply, rub adobo in and under skin. Marinate overnight. Roast covered at 325°F for 5 hours. Uncover last hour for crispy skin.

Carne frita.directions: Cube beef. Season with lime, garlic, cumin, oregano, salt. Fry in hot oil until crispy edges but tender inside. Serve with rice and beans.

Chicharr\u00f3n de pollo.directions: Marinate chicken in lime juice, garlic, salt, pepper 2 hours. Dredge in flour. Deep fry at 350°F until golden and crispy, 12-15 minutes. Serve with mojo sauce.

Pollo guisado.directions: Brown chicken in oil. Add sofrito, tomato sauce, water, cubed potatoes, olives, capers, and seasonings. Simmer covered until chicken is cooked and potatoes are tender. Serve over rice.

Carne guisada.directions: Brown cubed beef. Add garlic, cumin, chili powder. Add tomatoes and broth. Simmer 2 hours until tender. Thicken with flour slurry. Serve with flour tortillas.

Sancocho.directions: Simmer chicken and pork in broth until tender. Add starchy vegetables in order of cooking time: yuca first, then potatoes, corn, plantains. Add sofrito and oregano. Serve with rice, lime, cilantro.

Mondongo.directions: Simmer cleaned tripe and ham hock for 2-3 hours until tender. Add cubed potatoes and yuca. Add sofrito, tomato sauce, seasonings. Simmer until vegetables are cooked. Serve with rice and lime.

Asopao de pollo.directions: Brown chicken. Add sofrito, tomato sauce, sazón. Add broth, bring to boil. Add rice. Simmer 25-30 minutes until rice is very tender and soupy. Add olives and capers.

Bacalaitos.directions: Soak salt cod overnight, drain, shred finely. Mix with flour, baking powder, garlic powder, oregano, and water to form batter. Drop spoonfuls into 350°F oil. Fry until golden and crispy.

Sorullitos.directions: Boil water with butter, sugar, salt. Stir in cornmeal until thick. Add shredded cheese, mix until melted. Cool slightly. Roll into finger shapes. Deep fry until golden brown. Serve warm.

Empanadillas.directions: Make Puerto Rican style dough. Fill with seasoned picadillo (ground beef with sofrito, olives, capers). Seal. Fry until golden. Serve with hot sauce.

Colombian bandeja paisa simplified.directions: Cook each component separately. Arrange all on large platter: rice, beans, ground beef, fried chorizo, chicharrones, fried egg, arepa, sliced avocado, fried sweet plantains.

Arepa stuffed with everything.directions: Make arepas, grill until hollow-sounding. Split open. Stuff with layers of shredded beef, black beans, cheese, avocado, and crema.

Pabell\u00f3n criollo simplified.directions: Shred beef, sauté with onion, garlic, cumin until slightly crispy. Cook rice. Fry sweet plantain slices until caramelized. Plate with rice, beans, shredded beef, plantains. Optional fried egg on top.

Hallacas.directions: Make masa with corn flour, broth, annatto oil. Cook meats in stew. Spread masa on banana leaf, add meats, olives, capers, raisins. Fold and tie. Boil 1 hour. Unwrap to serve.

Teque\u00f1os.directions: Cut queso blanco into finger-length sticks. Wrap each cheese stick in wonton wrapper, sealing edges with water. Deep fry at 350°F until golden and crispy. Serve immediately while cheese is molten.

Churrasco with three sauces.directions: Grill steaks over high heat to desired doneness. Slice. Serve with trio of sauces: green chimichurri, fresh salsa criolla, and garlic aioli.

Lomo saltado minus veggies.directions: Cut beef into strips. Stir-fry over very high heat with garlic. Add soy sauce, vinegar, cumin. Toss with fresh hot french fries. Serve immediately with white rice.

Causa.directions: Make mashed potatoes with aji amarillo, lime juice, oil. Mix chicken with mayo. Layer in ring mold: potato, chicken, avocado, more potato. Unmold. Garnish with olives and egg.

Papa rellena.directions: Make mashed potatoes. Season and cook beef with cumin and paprika. Form mashed potato around filling of beef, olive, and egg slice. Roll in flour. Deep fry at 350°F until golden.

Jalea.directions: Cut fish into pieces. Dredge all seafood in seasoned flour and cornstarch. Deep fry until golden and crispy. Serve mounded high with fried yuca, salsa criolla, and lime wedges.

Arroz chaufa.directions: Stir-fry diced pork until cooked. Scramble eggs, set aside. Add rice, stir-fry on high. Add soy sauce, ginger. Return pork and eggs. Drizzle sesame oil. Top with green onions.

Lomo saltado chaufa.directions: Stir-fry beef strips over high heat. Remove. Scramble eggs, set aside. Fry day-old rice with garlic, ginger until toasted. Add soy, sesame oil. Return beef and eggs. Top with scallions.

Tallarin saltado.directions: Cook spaghetti. Cut beef into strips. Stir-fry beef over high heat, remove. Stir-fry onion and tomatoes. Add soy sauce, vinegar, cumin. Return beef, toss with noodles.

Pollo a la brasa.directions: Blend marinade: soy sauce, lime juice, cumin, paprika, garlic, oregano, oil. Marinate chicken overnight. Roast at 400°F or spit-roast until skin is crispy and internal temp 165°F. Serve with aji verde and fries.

Aji verde sauce.directions: Blend all ingredients until smooth. Adjust lime juice and salt to taste. Refrigerate 30 minutes for flavors to meld. Serve with chicken, steak, or potatoes.

Seco de cordero.directions: Blend cilantro to make sauce. Brown lamb pieces. Add onion, garlic, aji amarillo, cumin. Add cilantro sauce and beer. Braise until tender. Serve with potatoes, beans, and rice.

Tacu tacu.directions: Mash day-old rice and beans together. Form into thick patty. Fry in oil until crispy on both sides. Serve topped with fried egg and pan-seared steak.

Ceviche.directions: Dice fish small. 'Cook' in lime juice 20-30 minutes until opaque. Add sliced red onion, chopped cilantro, minced serrano, salt. Serve immediately on tostadas.

Tiradito.directions: Slice fish paper thin. Make sauce with lime juice, aji amarillo paste, garlic, ginger. Arrange fish on plate. Pour sauce over just before serving. Garnish with cilantro and toasted corn.

Leche de tigre.directions: Blend fish scraps with lime juice, aji amarillo, onion, garlic, ginger, cilantro, and fish stock. Strain through fine mesh. Season with salt. Serve chilled as a shot or with fresh fish.

Aguachile.directions: Butterfly shrimp, 'cook' in lime juice 15 minutes. Blend lime juice with serranos and cilantro. Slice cucumber. Toss shrimp with green sauce, top with cucumber. Serve on tostadas.

Ceviche de camar\u00f3n.directions: Poach or 'cook' shrimp in lime juice. Add diced tomatoes, cucumber, red onion, serrano, cilantro. Season with hot sauce and salt. Serve chilled with tostadas.

Ceviche mixto.directions: Cook octopus until tender, slice. 'Cook' diced fish and shrimp in lime juice. Combine with octopus, onion, cilantro, aji. Serve with corn kernels and sweet potato slices.

Crab ceviche.directions: Combine crab with lime juice, diced avocado, tomatoes, onion, serrano, cilantro. Season with salt. Serve chilled on tostadas.

Octopus ceviche.directions: Boil octopus until tender. Slice thin. Marinate in lime juice with sliced red onion, aji limo, cilantro. Season with salt and olive oil. Serve with sweet potato and toasted corn.

Pulpo a la gallega.directions: Freeze and thaw octopus to tenderize. Boil in unsalted water, dipping 3 times before submerging. Cook 45 minutes. Boil potatoes in same water. Slice both. Drizzle with olive oil, paprika, and coarse salt.

Pulpo a la parrilla.directions: Boil octopus until tender. Drain and dry. Grill over high heat until charred. Slice, drizzle with garlic olive oil, lemon juice, smoked paprika. Garnish with parsley.

Gambas a la plancha.directions: Heat plancha or cast iron until smoking. Season shrimp with salt. Cook in olive oil 1-2 minutes per side. Finish with garlic, parsley, lemon. Simple and perfect.

Calamares fritos.directions: Clean and slice squid into rings. Dredge in seasoned flour. Fry at 375°F 2-3 minutes until golden and crispy. Don't overcook. Serve with lemon and aioli.

Paella mixta.directions: Sear chicken and chorizo. Add rice, saffron, broth. Arrange seafood on top. Cook without stirring until rice absorbs liquid and bottom is crispy (socarrat). Rest 5 minutes.

Paella de mariscos.directions: Make sofrito with garlic and tomato. Add rice and saffron. Pour fish stock. Arrange seafood on top. Cook until rice is done and socarrat forms on bottom. Serve with lemon wedges.

Fideu\u00e0.directions: Toast noodles in oil until golden. Add garlic and paprika. Add saffron-infused broth. Simmer 10 minutes. Add seafood, cover 5 minutes until shells open. Let rest 5 minutes. Serve with dollop of aioli.

Arroz negro.directions: Clean squid, reserve ink. Sauté squid and garlic in oil. Add rice, coat in oil. Add broth and squid ink. Simmer covered 18 minutes until rice is tender. Garnish with parsley.

Arroz a banda.directions: Toast rice in olive oil with garlic and paprika. Add saffron-infused fish broth. Simmer until rice is tender and liquid absorbed. Serve with seared shrimp and aioli.

Cochinillo asado.directions: Score skin of suckling pig. Season inside with garlic, herbs, salt. Roast at 350°F 2-3 hours, basting with wine and oil, until meat is tender and skin is crackling crisp. Traditional Castilian dish.

Cordero asado.directions: Stud lamb with garlic. Season with rosemary, salt, pepper. Roast at 325°F with wine and oil 3-4 hours. Add potatoes last hour. Baste frequently. Spanish roast lamb.

Chulet\u00f3n.directions: The Spanish tomahawk. Bring 2+ inch thick steak to room temp. Season heavily with coarse salt. Grill over high heat 5-6 minutes per side for medium-rare. Rest. Slice against bone.

Secreto ib\u00e9rico.directions: Bring meat to room temperature. Season generously with coarse salt. Grill over high heat 3-4 minutes per side for medium. Rest 5 minutes. Slice against grain. Drizzle with olive oil.

Presa ib\u00e9rica.directions: Season presa with salt. Sear in hot pan with rosemary until golden on all sides. Finish in 375°F oven to medium. Rest 10 minutes. Slice thin. Drizzle with olive oil.

Pluma ib\u00e9rica.directions: Bring meat to room temperature. Season with coarse salt. Grill over very high heat 2-3 minutes per side. Rest 5 minutes. Slice. Finish with garlic-infused olive oil.

Jam\u00f3n ib\u00e9rico.directions: Slice paper-thin at room temperature using a long sharp knife. Cut parallel to the bone. Arrange slices on plate without overlapping. Serve immediately to enjoy the fat melting at room temperature.

Jam\u00f3n serrano.directions: Secure leg in jamonero. Slice very thin parallel to bone. Serve at room temperature to allow fat to soften. Pair with manchego cheese, crusty bread, or melon.

Manchego and membrillo.directions: Slice Manchego into wedges. Cut membrillo into small blocks. Arrange on board with marcona almonds and crusty bread. Pair cheese with equal-sized piece of membrillo for each bite.

Tortilla espa\u00f1ola loaded.directions: Slowly fry cubed potatoes and onion in olive oil until very tender. Drain, mix with beaten eggs. Add chorizo and cheese. Cook in pan, flip carefully. Finish until just set inside. Serve warm or room temperature.

Huevos rotos.directions: Cut potatoes into irregular chunks. Fry in olive oil until golden and crispy. Season with salt. Top with thin slices of jamón. Fry eggs with runny yolks, place on top. Break yolks at the table so they coat potatoes.

Patatas bravas with two sauces.directions: Fry potato chunks until golden and crispy. Make aioli: mayo blended with garlic. Make bravas sauce: tomato sauce with paprika and cayenne. Drizzle both sauces over crispy potatoes.

Croquetas de jam\u00f3n.directions: Make thick béchamel: cook flour in butter, add milk, stir until very thick. Add finely diced ham and nutmeg. Spread on sheet, chill until firm. Shape into cylinders. Bread with flour, egg, breadcrumbs. Fry at 350°F until golden.

Croquetas de pollo.directions: Finely shred cooked chicken. Make thick béchamel, fold in chicken. Chill until firm. Shape into cylinders. Dredge in flour, egg, breadcrumbs. Fry at 350°F until golden.

Croquetas de bacalao.directions: Desalt and shred cod. Make thick béchamel with butter, flour, milk. Fold in cod. Chill until firm. Shape into cylinders. Bread with flour, egg, breadcrumbs. Fry until golden.

Bu\u00f1uelos de bacalao.directions: Soak and desalt cod. Boil with potatoes until both tender. Mash together with eggs, garlic, parsley. Form fritters. Fry at 350°F until golden. Drain and serve.

Chorizo a la sidra.directions: Poke holes in chorizo. Simmer in hard cider with bay leaf 20-25 minutes. Let cider reduce. Chorizo should be cooked through with cider flavor. Serve with crusty bread.

Chorizo al vino.directions: Poke holes in chorizo. Simmer in red wine with bay leaf and garlic 20-25 minutes until cooked through and wine reduces. Slice and serve with bread to soak up wine sauce.

Boquerones fritos.directions: Clean anchovies, fan out. Dredge in seasoned flour. Deep fry at 375°F until golden and crispy, about 2 minutes. Drain. Season with salt. Serve with lemon.

Boquerones en vinagre.directions: Clean and fillet anchovies. Marinate in vinegar 6-8 hours until white and 'cooked'. Drain. Dress with olive oil, minced garlic, parsley. Serve cold as tapas.

Anchovy toast.directions: Toast bread. Mash anchovies with softened butter, garlic, lemon juice. Spread on toast. Garnish with parsley.

Pan con tomate... tomato.directions: Toast bread. Rub with cut garlic clove. Cut tomato in half, rub onto bread letting pulp soak in. Drizzle generously with olive oil. Sprinkle with salt.

Morcilla.directions: Remove casing from morcilla. Crumble and pan-fry until crispy. Alternatively, slice thick and sear. Serve on crusty bread with piquillo peppers or with fried eggs.

Fabada asturiana.directions: Soak beans overnight. Cover with water, add pork, bacon, bay leaf. Simmer 1.5 hours. Add chorizo, blood sausage, saffron. Simmer 30 more minutes until beans are creamy. Season with salt and pepper. Let rest before serving.

Cocido madrile\u00f1o.directions: Traditional Madrid version. Slow cook meats with chickpeas. Serve as three vuelcos: soup with noodles, vegetables and chickpeas, then meats sliced on platter.

Callos a la madrile\u00f1a.directions: Simmer tripe with ham hock until very tender, 3+ hours. Add sliced chorizo, morcilla, chickpeas, tomato sauce, paprika, bay leaf, garlic. Simmer 30 more minutes until thick.

Rabo de toro.directions: Dredge oxtail in flour, brown well. Sauté vegetables. Add wine, reduce. Add broth and herbs. Braise covered at 300°F for 4+ hours until meat falls off bone. Reduce sauce, serve over mashed potatoes.

Carrillada.directions: Season and brown pork cheeks. Add wine, reduce by half. Add broth, tomato paste, herbs, garlic. Braise covered at 300°F 3 hours until meltingly tender.

Solomillo al whisky.directions: Season and slice tenderloin into medallions. Sear in butter 2-3 minutes per side. Remove. Sauté shallots. Add whisky (flame if desired). Add cream and mustard. Simmer until thickened. Return pork to coat.

Flamenqu\u00edn.directions: Pound pork thin. Roll around jamón serrano strips. Bread with flour, egg, breadcrumbs. Deep fry until golden and cooked through. Slice on bias. Córdoba specialty.

Lomo en manteca.directions: Cut pork loin into thick slices. Season with salt, paprika, garlic, oregano. Confit in lard with bay leaf at 200°F for 3 hours. Store submerged in fat. Fry pieces as needed until crispy.

Ajo blanco.directions: Soak bread in water. Blend almonds with garlic, bread, olive oil, vinegar until creamy. Add cold water to thin. Season with salt. Serve cold with green grapes.

Gachas.directions: Fry pork belly and chorizo. Remove. Toast flour in fat. Add paprika, garlic. Slowly add water, stirring to form porridge. Cook until thick. Serve with crispy pork and chorizo on top.

Escudella.directions: Catalan Christmas stew. Simmer meats with beans and chickpeas 2-3 hours. Add potatoes and cabbage last 30 minutes. Serve broth with noodles first, then meats and vegetables separately.

Suquet de peix.directions: Make picada by grinding almonds, garlic, parsley. Fry potatoes and tomato. Add fish stock, saffron, picada. Add fish and clams. Simmer until fish is cooked and clams open. Serve in bowl with broth.

Romesco sauce on anything.directions: Rehydrate nyoras. Blend with roasted tomatoes, toasted nuts, fried garlic, vinegar, olive oil, and paprika. Serve with grilled vegetables, seafood, bread, or as dipping sauce.

Esqueixada.directions: Shred desalted raw cod. Mix with diced tomatoes, onion, olives, pepper. Dress with olive oil and vinegar. Chill before serving. Catalan summer salad.

Brandada de bacalao.directions: Soak and desalt cod. Poach in milk until flaky. Boil potatoes. Mash cod with potatoes while adding olive oil and garlic until creamy and emulsified. Serve warm with toast.

Bacalao al pil pil.directions: Soak and desalt cod. Poach in olive oil with sliced garlic and peppers over very low heat. Remove fish. Emulsify oil by shaking pan vigorously until it forms white pil pil sauce. Pour over cod.

Bacalao a la vizca\u00edna.directions: Soak and desalt cod. Toast peppers, soak, blend into paste with fried bread. Fry garlic, add pepper paste and tomato sauce. Add cod and sliced potatoes. Simmer until potatoes tender.

Marmitako.directions: Sauté garlic in oil. Add cubed potatoes, paprika, tomato sauce. Add broth, simmer 20 minutes until potatoes are tender. Add cubed raw tuna. Cook 5 more minutes until tuna is just cooked through. Season.

Txangurro.directions: Cook and clean crab, reserve shells. Sauté onion and tomato, add brandy, flambé. Add crab meat and stock. Fill shells with mixture. Top with breadcrumbs. Bake at 400°F until golden.

Kokotxas.directions: Season kokotxas, dust with flour. Sauté garlic in olive oil, remove. Add kokotxas, cook briefly. Swirl in stock and parsley to create emulsion (pil-pil style). Serve immediately with sauce.

Pintxos spread.directions: Toast bread rounds. Top with various items: jamón, anchovies, cheese, tortilla wedges. Make Gilda by skewering pepper, olive, anchovy. Arrange on platter for self-serve grazing.

Gilda.directions: Thread on toothpick: guindilla pepper, anchovy, olive. Repeat pattern. Drizzle with olive oil. The original Basque pintxo - perfect with white wine.

Pintxo de tortilla.directions: Make classic tortilla española. Cool and cut into small squares. Spear each on thick slice of bread with toothpick. Serve at room temperature as bite-sized pintxos.

Txuleta.directions: Use 2-3 inch thick bone-in ribeye. Bring to room temperature. Grill over very hot wood coals, 5-6 minutes per side for rare. Season with coarse salt after cooking. Rest 10 minutes. Slice thick.

Cider house steak.directions: Season and sear steak. Remove. Sauté shallots. Add cider, reduce by half. Add mustard and thyme. Mount with butter. Pour sauce over rested steak.

Lamb chops Basque style.directions: Season chops with salt. Grill over high heat until charred outside, pink inside. Make dressing with minced garlic, parsley, olive oil, vinegar. Drizzle over chops. Serve with piquillo peppers.

Duck confit Gascony style.directions: Cure legs with salt, garlic, thyme, pepper 24-48 hours. Rinse. Submerge in duck fat. Bake at 225°F 4-5 hours until meat is falling off bone. Cool in fat. Store in fat. Crisp to serve.

Cassoulet toulousain.directions: The Toulouse version with lamb. Layer beans with duck confit, sausage, lamb. Roll pork skin for extra richness. Bake low and slow, breaking crust repeatedly.

Cassoulet castelnaudary.directions: The original without duck. Layer beans with pork products. Top with breadcrumbs. Bake slowly at 275°F 4-5 hours. Break the crust 7 times during cooking. True Castelnaudary style.

Confit de canard with crispy potatoes.directions: Cure duck legs in salt overnight. Rinse. Submerge in duck fat with herbs. Bake at 225°F 4 hours. Cube potatoes, fry in duck fat until crispy. Sear duck skin until crackling. Serve together.

Magret de canard.directions: Score duck skin in crosshatch. Season. Place skin-side down in cold pan. Render fat slowly until skin is crispy. Flip, cook to medium-rare. Rest. Make sauce with honey and orange. Slice and serve.

Duck fat fries.directions: Cut potatoes into fries. Soak 30 minutes. Blanch in duck fat at 325°F. Increase to 375°F, fry until golden and crispy. Season with salt and parsley. Rich and delicious.

Duck rillettes.directions: Confit duck legs in duck fat. Cool. Shred meat, mix with some fat, shallots, wine. Pack into jars, seal with layer of fat. Serve chilled with toast and cornichons.

Pork rillettes.directions: Cube pork, season with salt and spices. Confit in lard with herbs at 250°F for 4 hours. Shred meat finely, mixing in some fat. Pack into jars, cover with fat. Chill. Serve with crusty bread.

P\u00e2t\u00e9 de campagne.directions: Grind pork and liver coarsely. Mix with sautéed shallots, garlic, brandy, thyme, egg, cream. Line terrine with bacon. Pack mixture in. Top with bay leaves. Bake in water bath at 325°F for 90 minutes.

Chicken liver p\u00e2t\u00e9.directions: Sauté shallots in butter. Add livers, cook until just pink inside. Add brandy, flame. Cool. Blend with cream, thyme, lots of butter. Season. Chill. Serve with toast.

Foie gras terrine.directions: Devein foie gras. Season with salt, sugar, pepper, Sauternes. Pack into terrine. Bake in water bath at 200°F until 115°F internal. Chill overnight with weight. Slice and serve cold.

Foie gras seared.directions: Score foie gras, season with salt and pepper. Sear in very hot dry pan 30-45 seconds per side until caramelized outside but still creamy inside. Serve on toasted brioche with port reduction.

Surf and turf: seared foie and lobster t.directions: Butterfly lobster tail, brush with butter. Broil until just cooked. Score foie gras, sear in very hot dry pan 30 seconds per side. Toast brioche. Stack lobster on brioche, top with foie. Garnish with chives.

Wagyu beef tartare.directions: Hand-cut wagyu into tiny cubes. Mix gently with minced capers, cornichons, shallots, mustard, Worcestershire. Season. Shape into mound. Top with egg yolk. Serve with crostini.

Bone marrow with parsley salt.directions: Soak bones in salted water 24 hours. Roast at 450°F 15-20 minutes until marrow is jiggly. Make parsley salad with shallots, capers, olive oil, lemon juice. Top marrow with salad. Serve with toast.

Truffle butter filet mignon.directions: Season filets generously. Sear in hot pan. Add thyme and garlic, baste with butter. Finish in 400°F oven to desired doneness. Rest. Top each with slice of truffle butter before serving.

Lobster tail thermidor.directions: Split and broil lobster. Remove meat, dice. Sauté shallots, add wine, reduce. Add cream, mustard, yolks. Fold in lobster. Stuff shells, top with gruyère. Broil until golden.

Rack of lamb with herb crust.directions: Season and sear lamb rack until golden. Brush with mustard. Press on crust of breadcrumbs mixed with herbs, garlic, butter. Roast at 400°F until medium-rare. Rest 10 minutes. Slice into chops.

Duck breast with cherry gastrique.directions: Score duck skin. Start cold pan, render fat 15-20 minutes until skin is crispy. Flip, cook 5 minutes. Rest. Make gastrique: caramelize sugar, add vinegar, broth, cherries, reduce. Slice duck, drizzle sauce.

Seared scallops with brown butter.directions: Pat scallops very dry. Season with salt and pepper. Sear in hot butter 2 minutes per side until golden crust forms. Remove. Brown the butter until nutty. Add lemon juice and capers. Pour over scallops. Garnish with parsley.

Beef tenderloin rossini.directions: Sear seasoned tenderloin medallions. Make Madeira sauce: reduce wine with broth, mount with butter. Toast brioche rounds. Stack: brioche, tenderloin, seared foie gras, shaved truffle. Drizzle sauce around.

Veal osso buco milanese.directions: Dredge shanks in flour, brown. Sauté vegetables. Add wine, reduce. Add broth and tomatoes. Braise at 325°F for 2 hours. Make gremolata with parsley, lemon, garlic. Serve over risotto with gremolata.

Butter-poached king crab.directions: Melt 1 lb butter with garlic. Add crab legs, poach gently 8-10 minutes until heated through. Serve with lemon butter for dipping. Garnish with parsley.

Pan-roasted guinea hen.directions: Season bird, truss. Brown in butter on all sides. Add thyme, garlic. Roast at 400°F until 165°F internal. Rest. Make pan sauce with shallots, wine, stock. Carve and serve with sauce.

Dry-aged ribeye with marrow butter.directions: Roast marrow, mash with soft butter, garlic, parsley. Sear dry-aged ribeye 4-5 minutes per side. Add marrow butter, thyme, baste. Rest with butter on top to melt over.

Lobster risotto.directions: Cook lobster, chop meat. Toast rice in butter with shallots. Add wine, stir until absorbed. Add warm broth one ladle at a time, stirring constantly, until rice is creamy and al dente, about 20 minutes. Fold in butter, parmesan, lobster, tarragon.

Ch\u00e2teaubriand with b\u00e9arnaise.directions: Roast tenderloin to desired doneness. Make béarnaise: reduce vinegar with shallots and tarragon, whisk yolks over heat, drizzle in clarified butter. Slice tenderloin, serve with sauce.

Tournedos with peppercorn crust.directions: Crush peppercorns, press into steaks. Sear in butter. Remove. Sauté shallots, add cognac, flambé. Add demi-glace and cream. Reduce. Return steaks briefly to coat. Serve with sauce.

Venison loin with juniper.directions: Crush juniper, rub on venison. Sear. Roast at 400°F to medium-rare. Rest. Make sauce with shallots, crushed juniper, wine, stock. Reduce and mount with butter. Slice venison, sauce on plate.

Quail with bacon and grapes.directions: Wrap quail in bacon. Roast at 425°F until bacon is crispy and quail cooked. Sauté shallots and grapes. Add cognac, flambé. Add stock, reduce. Serve quail with grape sauce.

Squab with foie gras stuffing.directions: Make stuffing with diced foie, brioche, shallots, cognac. Stuff squab cavities. Truss. Roast at 400°F until medium. Rest. Serve with any accumulated pan juices.

Pheasant with wild mushroom cream.directions: Brown pheasant pieces. Roast until cooked through. Sauté mushrooms and shallots. Add wine, reduce. Add stock and cream. Simmer until thickened. Serve pheasant with mushroom cream sauce.

Wild boar ragu.directions: Cube boar, brown in batches. Sauté vegetables. Add wine, reduce. Add tomatoes, juniper, rosemary. Braise at 300°F for 3-4 hours until falling apart. Shred, toss with pappardelle.

Elk tenderloin medallions.directions: Season medallions. Sear in butter 3-4 minutes per side for medium-rare (don't overcook lean elk). Remove. Add wine, broth, juniper, reduce. Mount with butter. Serve sauce over elk.

Bison ribeye.directions: Bring steak to room temp. Season with salt and pepper. Cook in hot pan with butter 3-4 minutes per side for medium-rare (bison is leaner, don't overcook). Add garlic and thyme, baste. Rest 5 minutes.

Lamb saddle roasted whole.directions: Score fat, rub with mustard, garlic, and herbs. Season. Roast at 425°F for 25-30 minutes until medium-rare. Rest 15 minutes. Carve along the bone into medallions.

Suckling pig porchetta style.directions: Butterfly suckling pig. Season inside with fennel, garlic, herbs, zest. Roll and tie. Score skin. Roast at 325°F for 3-4 hours, blast at 450°F at end for crispy skin. Rest and slice.

Beef cheek bourguignon.directions: Render bacon. Brown beef cheeks. Add wine, broth, herbs, pearl onions. Braise covered at 300°F 4-5 hours until meltingly tender. Sauté mushrooms, add to braise. Thicken sauce if needed.

Short rib pot-au-feu.directions: Simmer ribs and bones in salted water with bouquet garni for 3 hours. Add vegetables last 45 minutes. Serve meat, marrow, and vegetables with broth, coarse salt, and mustard on side.

Oxtail terrine.directions: Braise oxtail in wine and stock until falling off bone. Shred meat. Strain and reduce braising liquid, add gelatin. Layer meat and diced vegetables in terrine. Pour liquid over. Chill overnight. Unmold and slice.

Sweetbreads with brown butter.directions: Soak sweetbreads, blanch, and press overnight. Slice, dredge in flour. Pan-fry in butter until golden. Remove. Add more butter, cook until brown. Add capers, lemon, parsley. Pour over sweetbreads.

Calf liver venetian style.directions: Caramelize onions slowly with sage. Slice liver thin. Sear quickly in butter 1-2 minutes per side. Add to onions with wine. Reduce briefly. Serve over soft polenta.

Beef tongue with salsa verde.directions: Simmer tongue with bay leaves and salt 3-4 hours until tender. Peel skin while warm. Slice or chop. Roast tomatillos and serranos, blend with cilantro and garlic for salsa verde. Serve in tortillas.

Tripe \u00e0 la mode de Caen.directions: Layer tripe, vegetables, and beef feet in pot. Add cider, Calvados, bouquet garni. Seal with flour paste. Braise at 250°F for 12+ hours. Remove feet, serve tripe with vegetables and cooking liquid.

Rabbit confit.directions: Cure rabbit legs in salt with herbs overnight. Rinse, pat dry. Submerge in duck fat. Cook at 250°F for 3 hours until tender. Store in fat or crisp skin before serving.

Rabbit ragu.directions: Brown rabbit pieces. Sauté vegetables. Add wine, reduce. Add crushed tomatoes and herbs. Braise at 325°F for 2 hours. Shred meat off bones. Toss with pappardelle.

Frog legs proven\u00e7al.directions: Dust frog legs in seasoned flour. Sauté in butter until golden. Add garlic last minute. Deglaze with wine and lemon juice. Finish with parsley. Classic French preparation.

Escargot in garlic herb butter.directions: Make compound butter with garlic, parsley, shallots. Place escargot in shells or dish. Top generously with butter. Bake at 400°F 10-12 minutes until butter bubbles. Serve with crusty bread.

Caviar service with blini.directions: Hard boil and finely chop eggs (separate yolk and white). Warm blini in butter. Serve caviar on ice with cold accompaniments: crème fraîche, minced shallots, chives, chopped egg. Guests assemble their own.

Uni pasta.directions: Sauté shallots in butter. Add wine, reduce. Add cream, simmer. Remove from heat, stir in half the uni until dissolved. Toss with cooked pasta. Top with fresh uni, chives, lemon zest.

A5 wagyu zabuton.directions: Bring wagyu to room temperature 30 minutes. Season lightly with salt and pepper. Sear in dry hot pan 30-45 seconds per side for medium-rare. The marbling provides enough fat. Rest 2 minutes. Slice thin against grain.

Wagyu fat fried rice.directions: Render wagyu fat until crispy. Remove crispy bits, save. Fry day-old rice in rendered fat until toasted. Push aside, scramble eggs. Add soy, sesame, scallions. Top with crispy wagyu bits.

Ib\u00e9rico pork secreto.directions: Bring secreto to room temperature. Season with salt and pimentón. Grill over very high heat 3-4 minutes per side. Rest 5 minutes. Slice against grain. Drizzle with good olive oil.

Ib\u00e9rico ham carved tableside.directions: Mount ham in jamonero. Using long flexible knife, slice paper-thin along the grain. Serve immediately on warm plate. Fat should melt from warmth. Drizzle plate with olive oil if desired.

Kurobuta pork chop.directions: Season thick chop with salt and pepper. Sear in butter with thyme and garlic. Finish in 400°F oven to 140°F internal. Rest 10 minutes. Deglaze pan with cider, add honey, reduce. Drizzle over chop.

Berkshire pork belly confit.directions: Rub pork belly with salt, thyme, garlic, pepper. Cure 24 hours. Rinse. Submerge in duck fat. Bake at 225°F 4-5 hours until very tender. Chill in fat. To serve, sear until skin crackles.

Heritage turkey breast roulade.directions: Butterfly turkey breast. Pound flat. Spread with sausage stuffing. Roll tightly, wrap in bacon. Tie with twine. Roast at 350°F until 160°F internal. Rest. Slice into medallions.

Pekin duck two ways.directions: Dry duck, brush with maltose and five spice. Air dry 24 hours. Roast until skin is crispy and meat is done. Serve breast sliced with pancakes, hoisin, cucumber, scallions. Confit legs separately.

Muscovy duck leg confit.directions: Cure legs in salt with herbs overnight. Rinse. Submerge in duck fat. Confit at 250°F for 3-4 hours until tender. Store in fat. Before serving, crisp skin in hot pan.

Goose fat roasted potatoes.directions: Parboil quartered potatoes. Drain, shake to rough up edges. Roast in hot goose fat at 425°F, turning occasionally, until incredibly crispy and golden, about 45-50 minutes.

Potato pave.directions: Slice potatoes paper thin on mandoline. Layer in deep pan, brushing each layer with clarified butter, seasoning with salt, pepper, thyme. Press firmly. Bake at 350°F for 90 minutes with weight on top. Chill, slice, and sear before serving.

Pommes maxim.directions: Slice potatoes into thin rounds on mandoline. Arrange overlapping in buttered molds like fish scales. Brush with clarified butter, season with salt. Bake at 400°F until golden and crispy. Invert and serve.

Truffled pommes pur\u00e9e.directions: Boil potatoes until very tender. Press through tamis. Incorporate warm cream and an equal weight of butter. Season with salt. Finish with truffle oil and shaved black truffle.

Gruy\u00e8re potato gratin.directions: Slice potatoes thin. Layer in baking dish with grated gruyère, seasoning each layer. Pour garlic-infused cream over top. Top with more cheese. Bake covered at 350°F for 1 hour, uncover last 20 minutes.

Blue cheese potato gratin.directions: Slice potatoes thin. Layer in buttered dish with crumbled blue cheese, garlic, thyme between layers. Pour cream over. Bake covered at 375°F 45 minutes. Uncover, bake 15 more minutes until golden.

Lobster mac and cheese deluxe.directions: Make roux, add milk to create béchamel. Melt in cheeses. Fold in lobster meat. Toss with cooked pasta. Top with panko. Bake at 375°F until bubbly and golden. Drizzle with truffle oil, garnish with chives.
